Reviews.Title: “Service:Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Ted J
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and prompt service with an aesthetically pleasing common space for guests were some of the positives to this b and b. What really impressed us even more was that, a last minute change in our plans, resulted in our having another person with us and requesting a cot in our room. The said they'd be happy to accommodate and ended up upgrading us to a suite at no extra charge! This made for much greater comfort for all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: freebyrd73
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with charm. I traveled to San Francisco for a vacation and this place fit the bill. It is 2 blocks from the cable car, and within walking distance of Chinatown. My room was on the 5th floor facing Bush St, which can be a bit noisy some mornings. Breakfast is adequate, but I was saving room for seafood so didn't want a huge breakfast anyway. Parking is a nightmare unless you valet, so keep that in mind, but that is anywhere in SF. Nice amenities and spacious rooms. I loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the 'White Swan Inn' of San Francisco and we loved every second of it. The Hotel is in a great location, very close to Union Square, China Town and all the main attractions of San Francisco. This little boutique Hotel is really a diamond in the heart of San Francisco. Rooms are quite big and decorated in a lovely way (flowered wallpaper in each floor/room). The bed is extremely comfortable and the bedroom offers all the things you might need, from the closet, to the big tv including an electric fireplace (very useful considering how cold and rainy San Francisco was). The room's price includes an American Breakfast and complementary soft drinks. The staff is kind and very helpful, always available. Since it is a boutique hotel in the heart of San Francisco, the building is quite old and it may cause some little problem (ex the sink gets always flooded) but these are very small issues compared to the great advantages this Hotel offers. We highly recommend to everybody, especially to who's in San Francisco for his honeymoon, as we were :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Great choice”
Reviews.Author: crownedqueenie
Reviews.Content: White Swan is in a great location. An easy walk to shopping and restaurants. The room was very clean and crozy. Loved the fireplace in the room. The breakfast in the morning is very tasty. Good options to choose from. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. Well worth price and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for visitors, but not if you need wifi.”
Reviews.Author: pcess_jo
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Francisco several times and normally stay with family. However, as I was on a business trip this time around, I opted to stay in a hotel in the city. I was impressed with the reviews mentioned in tripadvisor and went ahead to book. The hotel didnt fail. It was a great location in the city along Bush St where it is a little quieter instead of being on Powell St itself. The hotel is a beauty... not your typical decor. The fireplace in the room was definitely a draw for me. The dining room in the basement served simple and lovely breakfast (nothing huge like the typical American breakfast) but sufficient to fuel yourself in the morning. I didnt get to enjoy the evening wine and snacks served but my co-worker did and she said it was lovely, especially the ambience. The only hiccups I had were with the wifi - signal was not very strong and whenever I was on "facetime" (apple mobile app), the line would drop off which proved to be disruptive in the conversation. The other was the television - somehow I had only 1 channel and I had to ask the front desk twice to have someone come fix it. Wasnt a big deal since that 1 single channel had great movies for the day. I will return back to White Swan if given the opportunity or maybe I would try the Petite Auberge (also a Joie de Vivre group).

Reviews.Title: “friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kamkids
Reviews.Content: We were here for three nights in Feb. 2012 and enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was good the coffee good and the choices great.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this place!”
Reviews.Author: small2006
Reviews.Content: I hunted for weeks to find the perfect place to stay in SF as it was the last stop on our roadtrip and I wanted somewhere fancy but not too expensive. We loved this place! It was great value for money, in a great location, close to union square and the cable cars to Fisherman's wharf. It's on a fairly busy street but once you're inside the hotel it's so peaceful you could be in the country. Good breakfast and hot drinks available in the breakfast room all day. We had a queen room with a fireplace which was very welcome as the temperature dipped dramatically in the evening. Great size room and very comfy bed, we had room 24 which was on the ground floor next to the lobby but we weren't aware of any noise and slept very well. The gentleman on the front desk was very helpful as was the valet. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Just watch the post at the bottom of bed, I have a lovely bruise on my shin!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay something different!!”
Reviews.Author: jules9851
Reviews.Content: What a find.We were so lucky to find such a super place.Large rooms with a great feel, so homely.Well placed for Union Square. Room was changed without a problem as the ones at the front are noisy due to the road in front. Great lounge in the evening with canapes etc. Breakfast varied and adequate. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time here, just as good”
Reviews.Author: huntejk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times starting about ten years ago and you always wonder if quality has been maintained and it has. Rooms are all large and very comfortably furnished with old-fashioned furniture, much like a home. All rooms, I think, have a gas fireplace. The bathrooms are old-fashion but spotless. Our room also had a wet bar and small fridge with some complimentary beverages. Very good full breakfast included and fresh baked cookies out in the lobby in the afternoon. At five, they put out a tart and/or savory with tea and coffee and sherry in the lounge. The lounge consists of two very comfortable rooms with fireplaces. This is a great place to go if you are using more than two or more rooms since the lounge is a really nice place to get together during the day or at night. The rooms are also well set up for relaxing. Our most recent room had a wing chair and ottoman and loveseat. Great location for exploring, up a hill from Union Square. Sometimes there is noise on street at night, but we have never been bothered by it and my husband is a light sleeper. Less expensive than what we would consider a comparable hotel. Very homey feeling. They have wi-fi and a little workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: Every year at Christmas time my family tries to spend at least a weekend in San Francisco. The last two years we have stayed at the Inn and it has become part of our family tradition. It is a combination of old world charm and modern conveniences. The location is ideal, within walking distance of charming restaurants, really rowdy bars and, of course, great shopping!

Reviews.Title: “White Swan Inn experience”
Reviews.Author: chicca12345
Reviews.Content: I love this place very friendly, clean and very central to bus, trams etc!!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay all round”
Reviews.Author: Kosquitoes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Swan for 3 nights in Feb 2012 and really enjoyed it. It's a very flowery 'chinzy' hotel showing a great accolade to the UK with matchstick models of many catherderals and a vast array of royal memorabilia. You can peruse these during the free wine and hors d'oeuvre hour which we found a great treat and great start to our evening meal! We had a fireplace room which was very nice and very clean....although we did have to ask at reception how to switch on the fire as the switch was strategically placed behind the bed!! Breakfast was fantastic, each day a different variety of hot dishes available, in addition to fresh fruit, hot oatmeal (or porridge!) boiled eggs, homemade bread etc etc...wonderful. Although they do advertise they have a gym....you really can't call a small room with a computer, desk and chair, treadmill and bike a gym, however....why would you need a gym when you can step out of the front door and climb the hills of SF instead....its great exercise. The hotel is located a couple of streets from Union Square and many great restaurants, we also found a great bar at the end of the road call The Tunnel Top....lovely for a cocktail on the way back from the restaurant. All on all a really great stay....would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here in December 2011 when we were visiting his family in San Francisco. It is really an adorable place, with cute all sorts of collections of antiques for decor - teddy bears, china, even matchstick models. The old fashioned elevator was a real treat! The service we received from the staff was great. The maid service was especially good - when we put the do not disturb sign up, the maid left a bag of fresh towels on our door handle for us. Very nice! The breakfast has a fairly good selection and the hot food would vary from day to day. Breakfast is served in this downstairs lounge - they had it all decorated for Christmas! It has a fireplace sitting area, some couches, lots of room and is a great place to sit and chat. They also serve wine and snacks from 4-7pm, which was a nice touch and helped my husband and I relax after a day out walking. The room itself was was really cute and having a fire place was great and romantic! And everything was clean and well taken care of. Being a Joie de Vivre property, you can sign up for their loyalty card for free - which my husband and I did - which meant we got a little bottle of wine, some chocolates and free teddy bear upon arrival. This is without having stayed at one of their properties before, so you don't have to have any points to start getting the benefits! They have a valet parking service, which we used once when we rented a car - it was quick and I think the price was on par with what you'd have to pay elsewhere in the city. The only small issue I had with the hotel was that whatever cleaner they used left a smell behind, which made the place smell kinda like a hospital. We got used to it after a bit but both of us having mothers who are very sensitive to smells, I just wanted to point that out because if you are sensitive to that kind of thing, it could be a problem. But really, that's a very minor thing and everything else was fantastic. The location is close to Union Square, however, it is up a fairly steep hill - which you may be able to manage quite well normally, but with 30-40 pounds of luggage, we found it quite a challenge. Please keep that in mind if you decide to take transit from the airport rather than a shuttle or taxi. Overall, such a great experience! We would definitely go back on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A unique and comfortable experience near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: mac_the_wild_rover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose White Swan Inn for a long weekend in San Francisco, and enjoyed it immensely. It's a few (steep) blocks from Union Square, with a selection of bars and restaurants, some of them exceptional, nearby. Our clean, comfortable room on the fifth floor was large, bright, and interestingly decorated, with bay window and a gas fireplace. It's an old building, but in good repair, and quiet even though in the heart of the city. The elevator is old-style, with a gate and manual door, but works fine. The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and service oriented. The hot breakfast was excellent quality, a different selection each day, and the evening wine and hor d'oeuvres gathering provided a comfortable place to unwind and socialize with other guests, or a quiet moment at the end of the day. We will definitely return the next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bathtub for reading in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PirateKat
Reviews.Content: This was a special from Joie de Vivre so I booked it from my husband's birthday. The room was huge, it seemed to have been recently decorated and very, very clean. Even though the bathroom was 'well loved', the bathtub (not a fiberglass tub) was one of the best for relaxing with a book for an hour soak. The bed was super comfy although the room, due to the hotel's age and location, can be a little noisy, but all in all a great stay. Breakfast and wine hour quite generous and tasty. I have to say that the all the Joie de Vivre hotels that we have stayed in in San Francisco have just been a delight, each one has it's own personality. We happened to be wandering around during the 49ers extraordinary win against the Saints - crazy! Nothing like a fine weekend in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bebe R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the White Swan Inn between Christmas and New Years. We arrived early which was not a problem. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely. Very spacious and comfortable. Loved having a real gas fireplace in our room! It was hard for us not to over eat at breakfast because everything was so delicious! After a hard day of sightseeing, it was nice to unwind and visit with other guests at the wine and hors d'oeuvre happy hour. The location is perfect. Close to everything. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Sshhhh .... Best Kept Secret in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Rudy E
Reviews.Content: ...If you are a couple looking for a truly memorable,reasonable stay in San Francisco, or anywhere... The White Swan Inn is that perfect get a way! Gas Fireplaces, old world charm, convenient location, 2 blocks from cable cars, walking distance to Union square, quiet neighborhood...amazing staff and service, complimentary breakfast in AM and wine and goodies in late afternoon are a bonus in classy surroundings with fireplace / library / outdoor terrace etc...and the elevator is old school fun! So if you really need a relaxing , romantic vacation, this is the place, but maybe we shouldn't tell the world! We cant wait to come back! Rudy and Chris Vancouver BC

Reviews.Title: “OK - But staff could use better time management skills!”
Reviews.Author: GK83
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and comfortable, breakfast was fine (although don't go if you like full breakfasts, cause it's all fruit, cereals, croissants and things like banana bread if you're lucky) Although after waiting in a quene for 25 minutes to check out, we then had to wait a further 45 minutes for the valet man to get our car (we weren't allowed to park it or to go get it ourselves - you HAD to use valet), making us late for a pre-paid excursion we were going to. Consequently we were too late for our excursion and missed it completely. We got no apology when we eventually got our car and if anything, the guy waited expecting to be tipped! Obviously that didn't happen. For this reason I'd not go back. However if you're a really healthy eater, even on holiday and you're not planning on taking a car then sure, stay here. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place in SF”
Reviews.Author: audiman13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights during our 3 weeks in California and I fully endorse all the previous good comments about the White Swan. Great location, lovely room, helpful staff, good breakfast , would definitely recommend and wouldn't stay anywhere else in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity amidst insanity...”
Reviews.Author: taylorcalm
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we only got to spend one night on a recent swing through San Francisco. Read the review on this site and decided to try it. It was a very nice evening. Within a few blocks of Union Square, easy to get around downtown. After circling the block a few times looking for a parking place, we were finally able to get close enough for the valet parking to take over. Check in was easy and the woman at the front desk was very helpful. We left the Victorian-era lobby and made our way to the elevator, which is one of those old-timey close-the-folding-gate-and-close-sliding-door kind of things. Very cool. Push the little button and the elevator goes up (or down) and lands on the correct floor...usually within an inch or two. The rooms were tastefully decorated in an Olde English Romantic style, but with modern amenities. The bed was very comfortable, the tub was big, my wife was happy. Breakfast was not outstanding, but very good. There were certainly some signs of age, cracked tiles, etc., but only added to the historic charm. We only wish we had more time, and we will definitely back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Ajc1213
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 25th wedding anniversary tour of California. We were not disappointed with our choice. They say that location, location, location is everything and this is certainly the case with this hotel. It is within one block (easy walk) to Union Square, from which you can connect to any part of the city. It is near numerous restaurants and within walking distance of many of the popular tourist spots. If you like the old worldly charm, coupled with a quaint old fashioned elevator and a spacious, lovely decorated room, then this is the place for you. There are warm comforting lounges, library and pleasant outdoor seating options. From the complementary breakfast, hot cookies in the afternoon and the evening wine and hors oeuvre reception to the ever helpful and responsive ancillary staff, this is a great place to stay. They have the valet parking option which is also convenient. It is important to remember that any hotel that is in the middle of a major city is susceptible to noise, however we requested a high floor, non-street facing room and noise was not a problem â€“ we were able to sleep easily with the windows open. Although my wife and I would stay here again in a heartbeat and will recommend this hotel to anyone we know who is travelling to San Francisco, there is only one thing that I could identify an opportunity for improvement, i.e., the friendliness of the hotel front desk. Although they were always professional and courteous, they lacked the sincere warmth and constant smiles that were always presented by the housekeeping staff. This however would in no way detract us from returning to this wonderful hotel. Good job White Swan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan Inn, a Great Find.”
Reviews.Author: librarian81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. It has an old fashion elevator that you have to slide the gate door closed. The fireplace in the room was a lovely touch. They also have fresh cookies of baked goods when you come into the hotel as well as a wine tasting with snacky things early evenings. Tha hotel is located only blocks from Market St. as well as near one of the famous SF trolley car stops. If you join the Joie de Vevre club online you also can get a half bottle of wine when you check in and we were also able to have a discount applied to our stay by asking that it be applied to the reservation we had already made. Thank you White Swan.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: debbiem14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights here. We were very happy with our room...it was clean and very spacious. Our room was on the 5th floor, street facing, and we had no problems with traffic noise. The old-fashioned elevator was so quaint. White Swan Inn is in a good location...close to cable car stop. The daily breakfast was very nice...fresh fruit salad, pastries, muffins, toast, quiche and sausages. In the evening we helped ourselves to hot chocolate and cookies. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TexasLuv2travl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I will be returning for our 4th trip to San Francisco and the White Swan. We love the cozy atmosphere, the fireplace in the room, the drinks in the fridge, the wine & cheese reception in the evenings, and the breakfast. And the cookies are a great treat as well. It is extremely convenient, taking the BART from the airport and trolley up the hill to the hotel. Whey you want to visit China Town, just take a right out of the hotel & walk a couple of blocks. Want to go to Fisherman's Wharf? Hop on the trolley & head that way. Everything is right there for you to explore this great city. If you are looking for a hotel with character, this is for you. If you want a modern, sleek, antiseptic hotel, go elsewhere. I agree that a little update to the hotel wouldn't hurt. The faucets do leak--they remind me of my grandmother's faucets in her bathroom from the 1940's. The wall paper is quite flowery & might not be my husband's favorite, but the spaciousness of the rooms is really nice and unusual for hotels in big cities. Anyway, the cookies are a great trade-off for him having to "bear" the flowers!

Reviews.Title: “Every detail addressed”
Reviews.Author: Mililani
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned for our third stay at The White Swan Inn - each stay is more exciting. Andy is always there to help with luggage, bus information, directions and he has the biggest smile I have ever seen. We saw many new faces this stay and everyone was extremely nice nd helpful. Breakfast is one of the best in town, and it is included in your hotel stay. Wine sharing is always exciting and we always meet people from different states and Europe. Linens and towels changed every day, along with toilet articles. The fireplace is always pleasing; an exercise room is in the back as is internet. Couldn't ask for anything more - and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “one wonderful night”
Reviews.Author: ozzygal5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for just one night at The White Swan to finish our stay in San Francisco. What a lovely old hotel! It's in a perfect situation too-only five minutes from Union Square. Our room was as chintzy as anything I have ever seen with lovely rosy wallpaper, rosy prints, lots of space, a sofa and a decent bathroom. The complimentary drinks in the fridge were a thoughtful, and unusual, addition. The lift was a real old Alfred Hitchcock movie one with a clangy gate and plush red inside. The wine and cheese at 5.pm was delightful and a really lovely meeting place for the guests. Breakfast was great too and the cookies in the lobby-oh my gosh! Lemon poppyseed when we were there. There were lovely teddy bears in the lobby too but I was a tad disappointed not to have one in our room! Our bed was only a double which was mildly disappointing and our neighbours were noisy, waking us up several times during the night. Not the fault of the hotel though. I had a bad fall in the dining room at breakfast time while carrying two cups of tea. There is a small flight of stairs beside the tea urn and I missed my footing and fell right down, in a mess of spilled tea and broken china. I was very shaken afterwards and have an enormous bruise to show for it but no serious injury thank goodness. The maids cleaned up immediately and other guests assisted me. I don't know if it was reported to management. Maybe something could be done to make that area safer? Anyway we enjoyed our night there and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure how this hotel gets such high ratings.”
Reviews.Author: Ronda S
Reviews.Content: There are good and bad qualities to this hotel. Some of the good things are; good location, very nice to have breakfast and afternoon snack included...the desserts were very good and the choc. chip cookies were awesome!! Also, it was nice to have complimentary water and soda in the fridge in the room. Generally the staff were pleasant and tried to be accomodating. The hotel itself I would rate poor. The room was quite large but with a poor lay out. Only one person could be in the bathroom at a time. The bathroom is in great need of renovation...floor tiles dirty looking and broken, the bathtub was dirty with scum and even after scrubbing didn't look much better, and all of the taps were leaking. The net curtains in the dirty windows were frighteningly dirty. The weather was hot and we wanted to open the windows and put the fan on but because of all the dust we waited to express our concerns to the person at the desk. Their solution was to put us in another room which was actually dirtier. We suggested that they remove the curtains, which they did, except for one panel which was left. They cleaned them(?) and replaced them the next day. When we complained about the dirty bathtub they sent housekeeping to clean it. The hotel is old and charming but it is in dire need of major cleaning. I would also suggest that they switch to shower gel instead of soap to cut down on the scum in the bathroom and provide proper cleaning products to housekeeping. Apparently there are "sound machines" to block out some of the street noise...it would have been nice to have been offered one, rather than find out about it on a review site after the trip...unless maybe they were broken or sent out to be cleaned and therefore not available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel near everything..just need to touch up a few small things”
Reviews.Author: faithd58
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed at this hotel from September 22-26. Three of us had the Ashleigh suite located directly adjacent to the lobby check in. The other four had two separate rooms. The hotel was wonderful! It is close to everything..cable cars, Union Square, restaurants and shopping. I always felt safe during my stay. The breakfasts were a great surprise..quiche, oatmeal, breads..fruits, jams, preserves, cereal...a different assortment daily. A favorite was the apple crisp. It was wonderful! At five o'clock wine and snacks were served. There were cookies available constantly. Tea and coffee were also plentiful. The rooms were clean, the staff professional. Each room had a fireplace in it along with very home-like decorative touches. Sodas and water are supplied gratis in the room refrigerator. The staff were all professional, friendly and informative. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the San Francisco bay area. My only criticism of the hotel is that they need to freshen up the entrance lobby and the fire escapes on Bush Street. The lobby needs a facelift. Of course, it is a busy place so it sees more wear and tear, however, when entering a building it is the first impression that a traveler has. I will be honest, when I first entered, I was a little concerned as the settee and oriental rug appeared worn. I also had noticed that the paint was peeling off of the fire escape. There was some paint missing on banisters as well. These are small cosmetic fixes which I am sure the owner will tend to. I must admit, the rest of the hotel was lovely, clean and comfortable...and as I stated the breakfast, snacks and wine were all outstanding!! Just bump up the lobby and fire stairs and it will be top notch all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Clean and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: soccr62949
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking at room at the WHite Swan Inn and it was the Tripadvisor reviews that helped. I am glad I went with the reviews on here, because our stay was fantastic. We are locals that just wanted a quick getaway and night on the town. The location of this Inn is the best thing about it. It is steps away from Cable Car ride, Chinatown, UNion Square and TONS of shopping and dining. We dined at Cafe Claude ( also highly recommended on this site) and it was only a four block walk. The room was very large and the bed was super comfy. The Breakfast was delicious and we were awoken with the yummy smells wafting from the kitchen. There was an egg frittata and belgian waffles. Coffee and tea service thtoughout the day and also the most delicious Blondie BRownies for a snack in the afternoon. We are American, but it was kind of fun to see how many British people were staying at this BnB. It is funny that even abroad, we like to be surrounded by comforts of home. This British BnB was like quick trip to the British Isles without stepping on a plane!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SanStormin
Reviews.Content: This quaint English-style hotel near Union Square was perfect for our 7-day getaway. Our room (huge) was on the top facing an atrium. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, and at night, we used the fan provided. With windows open, we didn't miss A/C. One night we needed the fireplace, which was cozy. Big flat screen TV was nice, with limited cable. Bathroom was small, but adequate. We liked the coffee/ refrigerator area with an extra sink. ++ Free spring water each day was great. We used the FREE wi-fi every day. All the staff we encounted were very helpful, and requested taxis showed up fast. The breakfast was decent with limited hot food and no milk alternative. I mentioned a mushroom allergy to them and they left them off the quiche. We took public buses and walked everywhere and felt safe enough. The complementary wine and cheese in the afternoons was nice. The old-fashioned lift is charming and slow. We ate outside on the back deck one morning, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The only negative is a small one: they need to invest in some bowed shower rods so that the curtain doesn't stick to you when showering. This is not a chain hotel with on-demand movies and every convenience, but it is nice and we didn't hear kids running up and down halls. All in all, White Swan gives super value for the money. One note: like all hotels in the area, you will hear sirens and emergency vehicles. The noise was no big deal with windows closed, but when opened, it was loud.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Inn”
Reviews.Author: elizcaz
Reviews.Content: Clean Rooms. Nice little afternoon treats. Staff was a bit aloof, but polite nonetheless. Good location, however, need to be careful at night. Comfy bed. Would come back and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StefanPapp
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly people, helpful services. Very nice room. The highlight of the hotel was the breakfast room with delicious breakfast a some room to relax and read newspapers

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, quaint decor in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BeenandDoneIt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably well located near the city centre in San Franciso. The decor is quaint with an English theme and a old-fashioned lift of a type that I have not used for years. The room was clean and well laid out and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel also has free wifi which we used. We did however find that some of the staff were not particularly friendly or helpful. The breakfast was fairly disappointing - with limited hot food and not a huge amount of choice when we stayed there. Whilst the hotel is well located - it is close to an area that you are advised to avoid after dark. Back on the positive side, the hotel does provide complementry cheese and wine each afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: woodlandschar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last couple of days of June. Awesome location, within walking distance of China Town, the F-Line, Union Square. VERY good value for the price. Complimentary happy hour was very quaint and cozy. Breakfast was not 5 star but certainly sufficient. We actually had some plumbing issues and had to retrieve a plunger from the front desk a couple of times and that would NOT deter us from booking again! It was a very old building and that added to the ambiance, but certain issues do come up. Absolutely LOVED, LOVED, LOVED it! In spite of minor problems, I DO recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A, fantastic small hotel near union square.”
Reviews.Author: theCCCCS-Afamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located two blocks from union square and the top of nob hill, and Just three blocks to the chinatown gate. The hotel has very nice rooms that make the TV feel out of place. The breakfast is one of the best I've had and there are many other complimentary additions. The hotel is one of the most secure that I have ever been to, so you will feel safe. All of their freshly baked goods are available all day and are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “What a Charming Inn”
Reviews.Author: BootGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely girls weekend in San Francisco and the White Swan Inn was just about perfect. The location couldn't have been better. The room was large and very comfortable for three -- my 11 daughter, my best friend and me. Breakfast was bountiful. Wine and cheese reception in the evening, homemade cookies in the lobby and helpful and accommodating staff. You really couldn't ask for more. Thanks White Swan Inn, you're definitely on my "I'll return" list.

Reviews.Title: “NOISEY”
Reviews.Author: sunlover777
Reviews.Content: no a/c so open windows and incredible constant street noise .they even offer earplugs once you are checked in . don't expect to sleep .

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: ckeller81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 38th anniversary at The White Swan. It is a great place, with a great location. Their breakfast is very good, and the room we had was very spacious, and comfortable. The front desk went out of their way to be helpful. The only drawback is no free parking, but it is downtown S. F. so that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: RichAndLaura
Reviews.Content: 10 nights at the white swan for a honeymoon. Absolutely loved it. Was just what we needed. I would give it 6 stars if I could! -Free wi-fi. You don't get this with the major hotels. Just ask. -Friendly staff. would do anything for you -Free Coffee and tea at any time -Lovely breakfast -Free wine and snacks at 5.30pm every day -Safe. good location (3 or 4 mins walk from chinatown) -Complimentary drinks replaced every day in fridge. The list goes on and on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKarin_11
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. A small, familary hotell. With nice breakfast. There is not much but enough. With both hot and cold food. And nice sweeties and fruit. If we are going to SF another time we will definitely live here. It was a good price comparing to what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gurnee_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over 15 years ago and tried it again. Location is great and convenient to the financial district, Chinatown and the cable cars. We stayed for three nights in a king size room. Breakfast regularly consisted of quiche, a breakfast meat (usually sausage), cereal, breads, etc. All was quite good and tasty. Room was a little warm with no air conditioning and street noise too loud to leave screens open. Refrigerator was stocked with complimentary water and soda, a nice touch. Valet parking is expensive due to city taxes and a bit slow in delivery but convenient. Hotel also provided loaner umbrellas when we needed them during some unexpected rain. Kind staff and a homey atmosphere make this property a keeper. We'll be likely to revisit if our plans are in the SF area.

Reviews.Title: “A charming bed with a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MojoLad
Reviews.Content: One of the traditions of the English B&B is the "cooked breakfast," as contrasted to the "continental breakfast" of yogurt or cold cereal, and this B&B really lives up to the tradition. If you are a serious trencherman of the a.m., you can look forward to hot porridge, excellent quiche (an easy dish to do badly), sausage, toast & marmalade, pastries, fresh fruit, croissants, fruit juices, fine coffee and a variety of teas. For both the days we stayed there, we could skip lunch altogether with no trouble; there is also a free wine, cheese and biscuit soirÃ©e every afternoon. (And free cookies in the lobby!) Our room was nicely turned out as well; quite spacious, comfy, and tastefully decorated if a little on the froufrou side. It was quiet despite the hotel's central location, though the plumbing was somewhat noisy, not surprising since the shower was like a fire hydrant -- just the way I like it! -- with an old fashioned bathtub for the more genteel bather. The staff were courteous and very much on the ball. Best recommendation: many of the guests I chatted up at breakfast were English!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SFA10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the White Swan Inn for three nights. The hotel is well-situated, being only a couple of blocks from Union Square.Â  Our room (a standard queen) was clean and quite large. The bed was comfortable although a bit creaky! The room was equipped with a large flat screen tv, coffee maker and fridge stocked with complimentary cans of soft drinks and bottles of water (a nice touch!). Although the bathroom was of reasonable size with a decent shower, it could have done with a little maintenance as there were some tiles missing from the floor.Â  There has clearly been a lot of effort made into styling the hotel as a traditional English "inn". The decor is flowery, with teddy bears and teapots almost everywhere! Of particular note is the elevator, which is a very old design and quite unique. We ate breakfast at the hotel during our stay. This was a buffet arrangement, with a reasonable selection of cold and hot items including tasty homemade bread. Free homemade cookies were available in the lobby throughout the day, as well as free self-serve hot drinks being available throughout the day in the dining area. The only real negative about the hotel for us was the front desk staff. We dealt with several during our stay and, although the did their jobs ok, they all seemed a little apathetic.Â  A quick recommendation on a nearby restaurant... Uncle Vitos on Bush Street (the same as the hotel) is pretty good. It does not look much from the outside, although we enjoyed a tasty pizza meal there. The place was very busy and had a nice buzzy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Long awaited, and worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: Joyous56
Reviews.Content: We were planning a SF trip last year, and hoped to stay at the White Swan, but alas, we planned too late and there was no availability. This year we planned early, and were lucky to score a twin room for a week...5/21 - 5/28. The room was great...spacious, and with a dressing room in addition to the bathroom. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful; I've read reviews that said it wasn't "gourmet" as advertised, but I think you need to be realistic, given the price. Fresh fruits, juice, eggs, oatmeal, baked goods...what more would anyone want? We only went to the 'happy hour' once, because we were always somewhere else or too tired, but I did tuck in another time. Wine was local and good and not limited, and some yummy treats which vary from day to day. All in all, White Swan was a great choice....location was good, accommodations really comfortable, breakfast and 'happy hour'....it was certainly worth the price, which was pretty reasonable, considering the cost of staying in SF. Thanks White Swan!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay at the White Swan Inn!”
Reviews.Author: LucindaVan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to travel spontaneously and were looking for a nice place to stay in San Francisco. We really feel we lucked out in booking two nights at the White Swan Inn on short notice. We greeted by friendly staff--especially Andy who helped us with our car, bikes and luggage, and gave us the lay of the area upon our arrival. The front desk staff kindly upgraded us to a larger room. We found our room (#32) to be very spacious, clean, and charming with lovely touches including a sink and make up mirror/hair dryer in a large brightly lit closet, wet bar, fridge with complimentary cold drinks, and nice sitting area. The only thing about the room we didn't care for was the squishy bathroom (2nd sink, bathtub, and toilet). It was really tight in there. Each morning, they served us lovely fresh breads, fruits, juice, cereals, egg dishes, and potatoes. Coffee was delicious and always available. Staff also provided us with wonderful restaurant recommendations within walking distance of the hotel. We had no disappointments during our stay. If you are looking for warmth and charm, we highly recommend the White Swan Inn. We will definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “QUAINT AND COMFY B&B”
Reviews.Author: ronadebra
Reviews.Content: Stayed a wk at this lovely, clean hotel.Bathroom was small. Fridge was stocked with water and soda-gratis Staff was super friendly,especially Andy. He gave us great direction, helped with luggage etc. Bed was super comfortable. We used the fireplace one cool nite, when we returned from dinner. Breakfast was delicious. Choice of fruit,pastry,croissants, eggs,cereal etc. The cook made a great quiche some days. Five PM wine was nice, even thought we didnt make it every day. One day they had awsome sweet/sour meatballs. Other days it was a cheese plate or veggies. Always with either brownies, or a bundt cake. Location was good for walking or taking cable car or buses. would definately stay here if we return to SFO

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SUITE FOR A FAMILY - LOVED THE FIREPLACES AND AMBIANCE”
Reviews.Author: sunriser8
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 in their two bedroom suite - loved the fireplaces and the little nooks and crannies throughout. Definitely much nicer than staying in a corporate "souless" hotel. Nice breakfast in the AM. Great Ramen Noodle place just a few doors down! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan Inn defines the word charm.”
Reviews.Author: foolmoon25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus another couple wrapped up a two week vacation in California with a three night stay at the White Swan Inn. There simply are not adequate superlatives to describe the charm and comfort this lovely hotel exudes. We were breathless when we stepped into our room ... all the comforts one would expect from a nice hotel but to also have a fireplace in your room is way over the top. We would not hesitate one moment to stay there again. If you're traveling to San Francisco (whether business or leisure), be sure to include The White Swan Inn in your travel plans. Terry & Ghee (Charleston, WV)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B&B choice in a downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousColorado2
Reviews.Content: I had a group of friends with me and we all stayed at the White Swan for one night on our way to Napa Valley. The hotel is a few convenient blocks from Union Square, the trolley, BART, Chinatown and several great restaurants. The rooms are quite spacious (all single queens) which works for couples and girlfriends, but may not for families. Extra amenities included a fireplace and supplemental area for sitting. We had plenty of room to spread out and have some closet space. The only thing that can be a little much is the floral decor (wallpaper, carpet, upholstery) but this is a minor detail. The hotel was surprisingly quiet since it is on a major street, but our room looked into the interior of the hotel and I'm not sure if all of them do. The breakfast was lovely, lots of hot and cold choices and the hotel also offers a nice afternoon wine happy hour. The hotel has a fun, old school elevator with a metal grate door and a sliding metal door with manual push button controls. There is definitely a knack to working this! This hotel is a wonderful choice for the value, location and extra amenities that they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: joolsfelixstowe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, centrally located and the people were very helpful. The breakfast was great but did not go to the evening wine tasting as we were out and about. My only problem was the room, although it was roomy and we were allocated a suite rather than a room which meant we had 2 bathrooms, bedroom, lounge and 2 kitchenettes we were woken every morning by the chef coming on shift at 5am. (we were told it was the chef we did not actually see him) he would come in thru the gate that ran under the lounge and although we had both doors closed we were both woken every morning when the gate was left to slam and make a huge noise. So i would suggest that you would ask for any room other than this one even if they tell you you are being upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of England in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: mguerard
Reviews.Content: A part of the Joie de Vivre line, The White Swan Inn is well-located for either business or pleasure travelers. It's decorated in the English country inn genre, which means quite a bit of floral wallpaper. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms offer a small fridge stocked with free soft drinks and water. The building is a converted row house, I believe, and the rooms are all slightly different. Each has a working fireplace. The Inn offers rooms at very reasonable prices for San Francisco, and it's located near Chinatown and one of the cable car lines. Also just blocks to Union Square and the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel! Friendly atmosphere, great food and new friends...”
Reviews.Author: vanwagd
Reviews.Content: My wife joined me for a trip to a convention. She explored the area while I attended the meeting. We both loved the gourmet breakfast, and the afternoon wine and snacks. The chef was creative and provided lots of healthy, delicious choices. These events attract nearly all of the guests, many of whom were from out of the country while we were there. It was delightful! We made lots of new friends, and got tips about local "must see" restaurants and highlights. The staff was also extremely helpful. The rooms are charming, and the fireplaces a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Susand70
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, spacious rooms, charming touches, great value. Travel widely with work and would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “More than we ever expected!”
Reviews.Author: whitmog
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere they are trying to establish is succeeding . From the friendly staff , to the excellent location, to the lower level breakfast \ wine and cheese room . All made one feel a part of the Inn. Meeting similar like minded people that traded places to dine to sites to visit made the stay wonderful. One can walk out the door and catch the cable car, or go to the theatre within a stones throw of the Inn. Rooms are quaint and roomy and offer great value for the money. One has to be prepared to stoke it up hills and stairs but it is San Fransisco!

Reviews.Title: “British Theme B&B”
Reviews.Author: BillRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: The rooms are somewhat small, but you need to expect that in SF. There is a fireplace in every room (but no air conditioner, which is not often needed). It is a wonderful place for a romantic getaway. Join the Joie de Vivre system before you book and you will get a teddy bear Parking (as in anyplace in SF) is extra. Breakfast is to order There is a French B&B owned by the same people right next door and you can go there. The service is wonderful, the people friendly and fun to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “homey, very English small hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler33045
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the White Swan Inn in early March. Our room was large, with a king size very comfortable bed and a gas fireplace, which was cosy since it did rain that night.... The wine and hors d'oeuvres were a treat in the evening and the breakfast was excellent.. (both included in the room. )

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little english b&b feel”
Reviews.Author: beezergal
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend surprised me with reservations at this charming hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday. We totally enjoyed our stay from the moment of check-in. Exceptionally nice and knowledgeable staff, clean, tasteful rooms and an unexpected bottle of champagne with balloons! We took full advantage of the wine & nibbles every night, as well as the quiche and other goodies every morning, both served downstairs of the lobby in a wonderful gathering area. Gas fireplaces with a flick of a switch are everywhere, even in the rooms. Travellers looking for marble bathrooms and uber chic spaces would be horrified by the flowery wallpaper, winged sidechairs, and four-poster beds. Teapots, books, matchstick models of cathedrals of England and Matchbox cars are some of the items tastefully displayed throughout. The tiny elevator was a kick, and took some getting used to, even after growing up in NYC. There was a small exercise area, nice sized meeting room, two outside sitting areas, and a pay-as-you-go computer available. Visitors having problems with stairs, claustiphobia in elevators, or chintz, may need to look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: donCorleone44
Reviews.Content: What else is there to say when the hotel provides complementary bottles of water and soft drinks in the fridge, a full breakfast in the morning, and wine and snacks in the afternoon? Oh, then there's the fireplace in the room that lights up with the flip of a switch and a flat screen TV with about a hundred channels, if you need it.. The location of the hotel (they call it a bed and breakfast) is only about 6 blocks from Union Square and two blocks from the Powell St Cable Car. At Union Square, you can get the Marti, Bart, trolley's, busses, and the cable car. Also every high end and low end retail store imaginable. There are lots of restaurants within a couple of blocks from inexpensive pizza and small neighborhood cafe's to the upscale and expensive ones. The Hyatt, Marriott and the Sir Francis Drake are only a couple of blocks away if you want your expensive glitzy hotel scene but honestly, for the price, you get a lot more for your, money with the White Swan. It's a large, clean and comfortable room with a really neat old elevator. The Walgreens about 3 blocks away sells metro passes good for all public transportation. Otherwise keep lots of singles in your pocket. There is a sister hotel two doors away with smaller rooms that are less money but all the same amenities .And one other benefit is FREE internet in the room. So between the internet, the breakfast, comp beverages and the evening wine, itâ€™s the best deal around. Opps, I forgot one thing, if you need a room with air conditioning; this isn't the place for you. They only have a floor fan for cooling. There isn't AC anywhere in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ocall0
Reviews.Content: We combined business (conference) with pleasure in a recent trip to San Francisco and this hotel fit our bill perfectly. I rode the Powell Street Cable Car down to make it to the convention centre and my fiance rode the opposite way to Fisherman's Wharf, etc. We booked the hotel because of the recommendations on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. Our room was spacious and quirky with separate dressing area (with sink and large mirror), washroom (compact but clean) and a bar with fridge in a converted closet. Gas Fireplace added ambiance. The decor is very "flowery", but reminiscent of an Old English Inn (which is the look I believe they aspired to). Breakfast was very good and convenient and the wine and cheese receptions in the in the evenings were also very much appreciated. Tips.... if you get a room on the street, while not noisy, it does have typical traffic sounds that you wouldn't get on the 20th floor of a high-rise hotel. Location is safe, two blocks from cable car (If you take BART into town as we did), DON'T walk up to hotel from Powell Street station... take a cab!, the hill is steep. Staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgable. All in all a highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place that exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: zxckelly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I choose the White Swan Inn after seeing so many positive reviews of it here on TripAdvisor and it certainly lived up to the praise received here! The rooms were clean and comfortable (ours even had a fireplace), the staff was friendly, and the included breakfast/wine reception was actually very good. Add to this a great deal (they were offering 30percent off stays of 3 nights or longer when we booked) and we came away very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back! What a great deal, what a great place.”
Reviews.Author: Auctioneer_Rob
Reviews.Content: If you are going to rent a car wait and get one across the street at Enterprise so you can skip the parking charges, just turn the car in after you are done with it. Easy walk to cable cars (turn right out the front door and it's just a block or two). Fantastic room, very clean (free mini bar, I know I never stayed anywhere with a free mini bar either). They even had q-tips in the room. Beautiful place, nice staff, great location, great deal. Loved the breakfast, and the wine with cheese at night.

Reviews.Title: “The way to enjoy San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: miaCB
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I picked this place to stay in San Francisco because of the fireplace in the room, the included breakfast, and the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. My boyfriend and I stayed here over the end of December 2010/beginning of January 2010. It was a fabulous location. We easily accessed public transportation (including the cable cars, BART, and Muni systems) which were only a few blocks walk away (downhill thankfully!). The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. When we asked for places to dine in the area, they were able to offer us an actual list of choices (and the one we picked had great sushi). If we needed something or had a question, there was always someone to ask. On New Year's eve we were going to the symphony and wanted to catch a cab. One staff member went up to the upper corner of the street to redirect a cab down to the front of the inn for us and another staff member stayed out front to try and hail one. I can't say enough wonderful things about the wonderful breakfast buffet. It was simple and delicious, The food was fresh, the bread and pasties were fabulous. The wine tasting in the early evening was a great opportunity to try wines from the region and the appetizers were wonderful! The room was comfortable and clean. We were right on the front of the building and barely noticed the traffic noises. The king size bed was heavenly to sleep in. And the fireplace was definitely worth it. It is a bit like going to grandma's house (the wallpaper is a bit overwhelming) but it is quaint, charming, and warm. This place has definite character. I have recommended this location to friends who are thinking of going to the San Francisco area. I am definitely hoping to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: annedotta
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable hotel I have ever stayed in. The little touches like fireplaces, free daily water and soft drinks, evening wine and canapes and afternoon tea made this place feel like a home away from home. The staff were also very friendly and helpfull. The position is also very convenient to union square, and the cable cars.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: I'mPedro
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding and the location superb. This was such a welcoming place to stay after walking all over SF. You get to curl up in an armchair in front of your fireplace and read or just relax. The bed left a little to be desired but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect welcoming place”
Reviews.Author: Tanderra77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn 8th Dec to 10th Dec, What more can I say but perfect. Very homey and such friendly staff. Not 1 staff member would pass us without a warm greeting and smile. Loved the room and bed so so comfortable.Loved The old elevator never been into the old style lifts before so that was fun. Room was spacious, very clean and tastefully decorated. Breakfast and evening wine were a wonderful treat...loved the red wine!! forgot to get the name of it so Ill have to email the inn. If i ever return to San Fran I wouldnt stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “For us, it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: iverh
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms for our family group of four from Dec 1st to 4th. The choice was based on good reviews on TA and a good price through Booking.com. I am happy to say that we experienced none of the problems descibed by Disneyfan. When we arrived at 1pm we were prepared for the rooms not being ready, but they were. The hotel is charmingly oldfashioned and cozy, the rooms are big and comfortable with nice sitting areas in front of the fireplace. One of our rooms was on the fifth floor facing Bush Street, but we kept the windows closed and noise was not a problem. The antique elevator is a gem, it only takes a ride or two to learn how to operate it. The breakfasts were excellent with different warm, cooked dishes every day. Afternoon wine before going out to dinner was an extra treat. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect, close to Union Square, restaurants, cable cars and other public transportation. I highly recommend this hotel, a lot more character than the typical chain operation.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could say it was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Disnyfan
Reviews.Content: I started planning my first trip to San Francisco on a whim about a year ago and fell in love with this hotel. Most of the reviews were awesome and it sounded like a great place to unwind after running around all day. I must say that my stay was what expected and more. The accommodations were like staying someone else's home, not perfect but just quirky. The room was comfortable and clean, a working fireplace that we even got the chance to use in July. Although the bathroom took a little getting use to (large old tub). The decorations was sweet and just so welcoming to sit and talk to other people. The couple of times I got to evening tea were memorable, meet some great people. The breakfast was awesome usually my best meal of the day. (Cooked meals everyday) One morning I went down early to make myself some time tea and the staff hadn't had a chance to prepare anything. The lady on duty was so nice to drop what she was doing just to boil me so water. This hotel is within walking distance of shopping, dining, Chinatown and the streetcars so we got around pretty easy. Like I said I was I could say it was perfect. I called a couple weeks before arriving to request a early check-in. The operator said that she couldn't promise anything and that was fair but I had also requested a room away for the busy street (good point to remember since you are downtown). When I arrive the front desk said that my room wasn't ready. No problem. But, the room they place us in was not only on the street but all the way on the top floor. So with the hotel's antiquated elevator (we never used to whole time we were there) this was not going to be acceptable. So after waiting a little (went to have lunch somewhere) we were place in a room on the back on the second floor where we were comfortable. I specifically told the front desk at that time that my mother would be checking in the following day so she wouldn't have a hard time. But, that is exactly what happened, she was given a hard time and was told that she could not check in. The last thing that really just left me with not so a great impression. Again the employee who check me in that first day, charged my card for $1000 for incidentals. When I asked about this, the young man that was on duty that day even thought that this was a ridiculous amount and doesn't know what that man was smoking that day. It took me a couple of visits to the front desk to straighten it out. Everyone else was so nice and professional, I don't know what was this guy's problem. The sad thing is I have yet to hear from management when I complained about it. So much for being perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy hotel, as well as great value”
Reviews.Author: j68_10
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere in this hotel is very strange for a big city hotel - it makes you feel positively happy! This is largely down to the staff, every one of whom I came into contact with, even just passing in the corridor, was welcoming, friendly, helpful and chatty. It made me feel completely at home. It was lovely to be able to look forward to coming back to the hotel rather than just treating it as somewhere to sleep. Breakfast was excellent (and, even better, included in the price). I was slightly apprehensive about going down to the evening wine & nibbles, as I was travelling alone, but there was no need to be. There is plenty space to sit on your own (and nod off, due to jet lag, in my case), or join with others if you feel like it - the sitting room area has lots of nooks and crannies, so it's all very relaxed, and the "nibbles" are far more substantial than I had expected. In fact I found I didn't need to go out for dinner afterwards, as I had had a reasonable-sized lunch and, having just arrived in the States, my bodyclock was out of synch anyway. Breakfast and the wine reception both had different offerings on different days. My bedroom was huge, with a good sitting area, and was very clean. The decor seemed a tiny bit tired in the daylight, but the room was lovely and cosy in the evenings with the living-flame gas fire on. There is a coffee maker in the bedroom, plus complimentary soft drinks (Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, bottled water) in the in-room fridge. Complimentary coffee and a wide range of teas is available in the sitting room day and night (with both china cups/mugs and to-go paper cups with lids, which was super-handy), and there is a jar of complimentary cookies in the entrance hall. There is a turndown service (I imagine that's why another reviewer's teddy bear wasn't on the bed when he got back...), so fresh towels are available in the evening if you need them. Bathroom toiletries are good quality. The hotel is in an old building, so its chintz theme didn't seem out of place (the old-fashioned lift reminded me of "Thoroughly Modern Millie", but I didn't need to tap dance to get it to work.) If you prefer anonymous hotels or sleek modern ones, then the White Swan is probably not for you. Otherwise I would heartily recommend it. It's great value for money anyway, but the feeling of being happy and at home is not usually something money can buy. I really feel I struck lucky with this one.

Reviews.Title: “The most charming accomodations I have stayed in for a very long time”
Reviews.Author: Happy123464
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn was booked on-line based on the web-site. The staff were absolutely wonderful, especially the bellman. He greeted us like long lost firends. The afternoon tea/wine event was good and very relaxing. The breaksfast was astounding both in quality and quantity. The larger hotels in the area cannot compare in charm and genuinely good feeling atmosphere. The room was large, clean and very safe for those traveling alone. I have traveled for many years and can truthfully recommend this as one of my best experiences.

Reviews.Title: “This is our place to stay whenever we're in San Francisco. We won't go to the city if we can't get a room here...period”
Reviews.Author: cfclark_25
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. It's small and cozy with great, helpful friendly staff. The suites are always clean and very comfortable. The location can't be beat and the breakfast and wine tasting are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: auemma
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful to find a B&B in such a great location. The rooms are large and have gas fireplaces. Being able to eat breakfast every morning without having to go to a restaurant was the best way to start the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We have been to SF several times before but this is now our favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: tirelesstraveler46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swan Inn for 4 nights, & can only second all the positive reviews we read on this website. We opted for a King room & requested one at the back of the hotel, having read reports of noise at night. Everything was as advertised, & we experienced none of the negatives sometimes reported. Bedding was comfortable & there was ample lighting for reading. The coffee maker & mini-fridge were nice, as was the extra dressing room with separate sink. We could occasionally hear people walking in the room above us, or a shower running in the adjoining room...but nothing that interrupted our sleep. Breakfast (both hot & cold) was plentiful & varied, with dishes replaced as they ran low. The same was true at the cocktail hour. A variety of different red & white wines were offered on different nights, as were cheese trays, olives, crackers, hot artichoke dip, hot mushroom & cheese dip, & always cake & coffee or tea. This was in addition to the complimentary bottled water & soft drinks in our room...& homemade cookies in the lobby in the afternoon. The atmosphere was that of a comfortable English country parlor, with a fireplace & lots of Royal memorabilia & books. As it was late October, our room was comfortable without air-conditioning. I'm not sure how it would be with just a box fan during a summer heat wave. All in all, we would highly recommend the White Swan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, welcoming, White Swan Inn enhanced our San Francisco visit”
Reviews.Author: inntripper
Reviews.Content: The White Swan was a lucky find for us as we planned our first visit to San Francisco! We chose it over the cookie cutter big name hotels, and also because it reminded us of our usual vacations to England. Our king room was large, yet cozy in decor. The staff were so friendly & helpful in choosing restaurants & giving advice. Breakfast was well presented, & afternoon wine & appetizers were a great treat in the fireplace common rooms. Take note of the model churches on display in lit glass cabinets, & the dinkie toy cars & trucks! Every nook & cranny displays a surprise! Hot tea & coffee & cookies welcomed us on our returns. Otis "original" elevator in smooth working order! Location was great for us, away from the congestion of tourist area, but close to Union Square & Cable cars. Very accessible. Street noise a bit bothersome even on top floor, but we did sleep with windows open!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small hotel near union square - a little bit of old England!”
Reviews.Author: BristolBaz
Reviews.Content: Great location - have to get the cable up (& down) to Fishermans Wharf but that was half the fun! Near the shops. Hotel had some good recommendations for restaurants. Wine and nibbles very nice we made sure we got back early a few days to do that. Room was lovely - very OTT on the decour but again was half the fun! Staff couldn't have been more accommodating. Only areas for improvement would be the breakfast - was billed as full English - no way. Quiche and small sausages do not equal full English. That was a disappointment but on last day did have scrambled eggs. Also the bed - when we arrived there was a lovely arrangement of cushions. For the rest of our stay they were piled in the corner - that let the quality down. But, overall, lovely and would recommend. Street outside noisy but didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: lmh16
Reviews.Content: Traveled to SF to participate in the Nike Womens Marathon for the 3rd year in a row. The White Swan offered so much for a reasonable (competative) price- service, service, service, valet parking at a VERY REASONABLE rate, breakfast, wine and cheese for happy hour, quiet and beautiful rooms. GREAT WATER PRESSURE! Will definately return next year and maybe sooner, if the spirit takes me to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdrpr
Reviews.Content: We arranged for three Deluxe King rooms, for just under a week, for ourselves and two other couples. Three young adult children shared these rooms with their parents for three of the nights. Everyone (all nine of us!) loved the hotel. We were in town for our son's wedding. The White Swan was a perfect choice. Each morning we met in the pleasant & tastefully decorated lower level for a nice breakfast. In most late afternoons we met for wine and hors d'oeuvres, and on a few late nights coffee/tea & cookies. Everything was provided by the hotel, free of charge. The large lower level is a natural setting for relaxing with family and, if you wish, interacting with other guests. We had fun chatting with couples from the UK and across the USA. The other families stayed in rooms off the street, but we requested ours to overlook Bush because we like the sounds of the city. The rooms are clean, spacious & comfortable. The bottled water & soda in the mini-fridge are free. All of the staff was wonderful, especially Ana who helped us make the arrangements for our stay and was at the front desk for much of the time, and Andy who looked after our needs on the lower level. Except for the spacious rooms, the White Swan has the look & feel of a charming European Hotel. The location is ideal: two blocks off California Street and the cable car to the Ferry Building, seven blocks from the Powell-Market hub, and with many reasonably priced good restaurants nearby. This part of Bush sees light pedestrian traffic and moderate street traffic. Cabs were easy to flag on the day of the wedding. If you don't know SF, the walk from the Powell BART station to Bush is pretty steep if you have luggage. But the effort is well worth it. We've stayed in many 3 and 4 star hotels in SF. This one's our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Short break after long flight before collecting our RV for an adventure”
Reviews.Author: SlimJim177
Reviews.Content: After a very long flight, it was a joy to arrive here and be given such a friendly warm welcome. The room was quaint and comfortable and felt more like a bedroom in a country house than a hotel room. Loads of tea and coffee available and gorgeous cookies to help yourself to in the foyer. The evening wine and hors d'oevres were fabulous. We sat talking until 10.00pm the first night and ate so much lovely biscuits and cake, we didn't need any dinner! Staff were very friendly and a credit to the hotel. Well done and thank you. It was a great start to a very memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Glennys
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights in this unique little hotel. Its exactly as depicted on their website (sometimes these can be misleading). Very friendly and informative reception staff. Porter, cleaning and breakfast staff all friendly and helpful. The decor is typically old english guesthouse. There was even a lovely teddy bear reclining among the heaps of pllows on our bed. There is no airconditing in the rooms and we arrived during a heat wave - however we found the fan adequate. Every day there were home made cookies in a big jar on a dresser at reception. Someone there is a great cook as there was also a morish afternoon tea provided in the loungeroom. Another plus, a good supply of bottled water and soft drinks provided free of charge in the room minibar and replenished every day. All these little extra don't go unnoticed. These is a large clean laundromat half a block away, also a good hairdresser, and the hotel is within walking distance to Union Square, just take your time walking back to the hotel as its pretty steep. The Powell St tram is only a block and a half away and its a 15-20 min trip to Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience ~ Terrific staff ~ A San Francisco gem!”
Reviews.Author: jcdlv
Reviews.Content: Nine girlfriends who've known each other from kindergarten to high school in Maryland, plus four husbands, were treated like queens and kings during our "Forever Friends 65th Birthdays Celebration" in San Francisco. Eric, Kevin, Brendan, Ana, Mike, and the staff went all out to make sure we had a memorable reunion. Great wines and hors d'oeuvres in the early evening, deelish breakfasts, yummy cookies in the afternoon, tea and coffee 24/7, lovely rooms (all different) with nooks and crannies and a bunch of books to read -- as if you couldn't find enough to do in San Francisco! The elevator is a surprise, a real conversation piece and perfectly safe (though one friend decided she'd just use the stairs). Be aware that there's no central AC -- although in SF, that's almost never a concern. Our weather was perfect, with great breezes available from windows that actually open. Can be a little noisy in street-side rooms ... but the White Swan offers free earplugs, if you'd like! As I said, they think of everything and make sure you have the best possible experience. Location is great -- just two blocks from the Powell Street cable car, lots of great restaurants within walking distance, not far from Chinatown, Nob Hill, Union Square, etc. The White Swan is a true San Francisco gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: hamburgbob
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Small boutique with quaint decor. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Staff was always helpful. Breakfast was a full hot breakfast each morning and excellent to start the sightseeing days. Nighttime cheese and wine was also a nice break to talk to other guests and wind down from the day. Also the location was perfect just blocks from China Town Gate and the business district.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: leylandii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located with easy access to Union Square and nearly all downtown activities. We were greeted warmly by the staff especially by, I think his name is Andy who was chatty all through our stay. We were shown to our room which turned out to have been upgraded to a suite so we had plenty of room to move about.The rooms were all clean and tidy, the only downside being that they all were extremely dark. there was no central light to put on, all lights were either wall or lamp standards.There was no air con(which we knew before we booked) but fans were provided which was great as the weekend we were there the temp reached high 80's all weekend. A 'delicious gourmet breakfast' was advertised. this was probably the most basic breakfast we had received in all our previous 6 hotel stays on this trip. Couple of cereals, couple of fruit, quiche (for breakfast!!) breaf and some cakes. definetly NOT gourmet. They served hors d'ouvres betwen 5-7pm which on the night we went consisted of 3-4 pieces of cheese, biscuits / wafers and some vegetables along with some bottles of wine. The major downside for us was the noise. Our suite was the Ashleigh suite which was on the ground floor next to reception. We were constantly awoken from about 6am by various noises either from the the basement area (staff preparing for the day), toilet flushes from next door, lifts or stairs being used. So if you book I would ask for the rooms above ground level as they may well be quieter.No real noise heard from the streets. This hotel was OK and 80% of it was fine, just the little niggles spoiled our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PhillyChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is a very quaint and charming hotel. You do feel as though you are staying at your grandmother's house, flowery wallpaper, antiques, etc. Our only complaint is there is no a/c and it did get in the 70s while there. So the room was quite warm. We were able to open the windows, but there iare no screens, so we were ate alive by the mosquitoes. That's is our only complaint, but a deal breaker when we return to SF. Otherwise, it is in a great location to Union Square and the cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel is in need of some modernisation”
Reviews.Author: Kungfudragon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and ideal for exploring San Francisco. Nice welcome to hotel from staff at the front desk. Room was spacious and clean. I did think though that for what I paid for the room it wasn't great value. Breakfast was very average, watery omelette, coffee not great as weak and a lot of things had run out. We were down about 9am and mentioned to staff there was no juice, they did get more but it was a bit grudgingly. Decor is quite dated and paint work is chipped in parts, so some freshing up decorating looks like it is needed. Also we could hear noises from other rooms like water pipes and street noise e.g police sirens from early in the morning. During 5-6.30pm there is complementary wine and snacks which is a nice touch. The only reason I wouldn't recommend this hotel to others is that there are more resonable choices nearby which are better quality and a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and easy location”
Reviews.Author: mattd10
Reviews.Content: After looking around for a safe and reasonably central location, settling on the White Swan was a good decision. I arrived at the hotel early and the staff were more than happy to get me checked in over two hours early (something you don't find everywhere). The rooms are comfortable, clean and have a distinct sitting area near the fireplace - I didn't get the opportunity to check mine out given the weather, but it felt like somewhere you could sit and relax in front of the fire on a cold night! Public spaces including the lower dining room and garden terrace were clean and well maintained with the breakfast and afternoon drinks served in this area being well attended and a good way to socialise with other guests staying at the Inn. A free copy of the San Francisco Chronicle is provided daily at the front desk and when I wanted to get access to the internet, I was able to get the right details quickly (though these perhaps should have been advertised in room - a minor detail). Staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and eager to help - the general manager overheard me asking for suggestions on the easiest way to get to Silicon Valley and went out of his way, without being asked, to gather train and bus details. While it might be their job to help, small touches like that and a willingness to spend over an hour talking about travel, world politics and anything else that came up made it an incredibly enjoyable stay. I'd certainly stay there again if I return to San Francisco - being only a block from the cable car and two from Union Square, White Swan gets my recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: LizEWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from California and stayed at the White Swan Inn for 3 nights.
