The location is just blocks from the cable car lines, the room was much more spacious than I anticipated, the breakfast and evening wine were great, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we even got to use the fireplace! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel--centrally located”
Reviews.Author: KenLang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2010 and everything about this hotel was first class. The rooms are spacious, original , clean and comfortable , the breakfasts plentiful and the evening complementary cheese and wine reception much appreciated and a great chance to talk to fellow guests and exchange experiences The staff were expecially friendly and helpful and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and room. The White Swan Inn comes highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Lamb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swan Inn as part 1 of our honeymoon in California. We couldn't have asked for a better start! After a $36 cab ride from SFO we checked in to our wonderfully furnished room (basic, but lots of space and decor that had real character). It was the perfect base to explore San Francisco. Just minutes from Union Square, or a lovely 30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39/etc ... Breakfast was fantastic, as was the service from the friendly guys at the lobby desk. Would definitely stay again at this perfect mid-priced hotel. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “On a noisy street-hard to sleep well, but great location and price”
Reviews.Author: 59travelmom
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the street so it was noisy. The room was warm with no air conditioning making it necessary to sleep with windows open so we heard the street trafffic all night. If you book here, request a room away from the street. There was a box fan provided in the closet which helped cool the room somewhat. The room was large with a comfortable couch and chairs. The bed had good pillows but was somewhat lumpy so not the most comforable for sleeping. The ironing board had broken legs. The bathroom was cramped, but it's an older building so that's to be expected. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful with bus schedules and routes to ATT park for a Giants game. The location and price can't be beat. Union Square is within walking distance. The bus line is only 2 blocks away. It's difficult to find a hotel close to Union Square for under $200, especially including a hot breakfast. The breakfast was good with crustless quiche, sausage, toast/jam, fresh fruit, milk and juice. If location and value are more important than a good nights sleep, then book here. If a good nights sleep is what you need, book elsewhere. I value a good nights sleep when travelling so would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandKittyMom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent a week at The White Swan Inn and absolutely loved it. We had a large King room with fireplace, bath, vanity area (great for two women and all their personal items), and kitchenette complete with coffeemaker and a regridgerator stocked with water and soda compliments of the hotel. The room had a total of three sinks! The bed was really comfortable and placed in an alcove where we could take advantage of the cool evening breezes (since there's no AC, and it's not needed in July in S.F.) The breakfast buffet was plentiful and varied a bit from day to day, and the breakfast room was cozy and afforded privacy if you wanted it. We loved the late afternoon wine and "snacks" which were bountiful - cheese, crackers, dip, fruit, cake and pastry, varying daily. We looked forward to this repast every day after a busy and tiring day spent sightseeing and shopping. We especially enjoyed meeting our fellow hotel guests and chatting for an hour or so before we all dispursed to go to dinner. All of this comfort was at a price I found incredibly reasonable for a well-located hotel in the middle of a big city. Best of all was the wonderfully attentive staff and the coziness of our home-away-from-home. The only thing you might want to pack if you get a room fronting on Bush Street is earplugs, but ours worked perfectly, and we slept like babies every night. I would definitely stay at the White Swan again if I were to return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “QUIRKY HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: citygirl53
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our weeks stay at the White Swan. Andy is an excellent member of staff - always friendly and helpful and a beaming smile.All the housekeeping staff are also very efficient and polite. The hotel is traditional in style but our room was vey large. The furnishings were comfortable and very flowery with lots of teddy bears around the rooms which was slightly odd - but that is the style of the hotel. The fridge in our room complete with free water and soft drinks was very welcome. We also had a coffee maker in the room. There was coffee and tea available 24 hours in the lounge downstairs. The breakfasts were very good and included fresh fruit , cereal, porridge,sausage and eggs, cakes etc. If anything was running low you only had to ask and it would be replenished. Every evening between 5pm and 6.30 there was also free wine and snacks in the lounge. It was lovely to come back to the hotel after a busy day and relax in a comfy armchair by the fire with a glass of wine. It was very chilly in San Francisco although it was July - we were told this is quite usual. One evening all the guests in the lounge decided to stay in and not go out for dinner, so we extended the "happy hour" by sending out for pizza ! We decided to buy an extra couple of bottles of wine for the other guests to share. A thoroughly good night. Overall a lovely older style hotel with a wonderful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: spillersm
Reviews.Content: We were greated by Andy as we came off the shuttle bus. He immediately assisted us in getting our luggage in the hotel. Anna was fast and efficient with check in. She explained breakfast times, wine & chesse tasting times and that our rooms would be stocked with water and pop each day of our stay. She told us that coffee, tea and hot chocolate were availabe in the breakfast room 24/7. Also she showed us to the cookies that would be available 24/7. As he took us to the room, Andy gave us the lay out of the land. He also reccommended that we purchase a Muni Pass. What a lifesaver, as you can get on and off the trolley cars as often as you like with the Muni pass. WIthout it, the trolley cars cost $5.00 each trip. Our room was clean and quaint, Andy showed us how easy it was to turn on the fireplace. Breakfast was awsome and each night we came back to cold or hot beverages, whatever we were in the mood for. My husband was known to grab a cookie as we were running from one activity to another. The bed was comfortable and I slept like a baby. And Im a very light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby is not Chic”
Reviews.Author: anninvan
Reviews.Content: Displays dusty needs refreshing. Curtains in shreds, bathrooms need complete reno. Now I know why there use to be elevator operators, don't plan on going down to get coffee, you need a sherpa. The beds were comfortable, the fireplace necessary, the wall paper over powers the decor. All in would say I would make another choice if I were to re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: JACKDAWS14
Reviews.Content: We would not stay in the Inn again. On arrival we where told that we could attend a wine tasting and when we asked what time we where told between 5.00 and 6.30, the time was then 6.10. When we arrived in the dining room there were no staff to welcome you or tell where to find wine glasses or nibbles of which there where very little. This event is to welcome new guests and a nice idea but they only had to check to see that not all the guests for that day had arrived or once they booked us in come down to welcome us. This we found was the standard of customer service in the White Swan, the front desk never spoke to you coming in or going out and they never offered to help with the cases up or down the steep steps to the road. Breakfast was very limited, if you came down at the wrong time the food had not been replenished the selection was not good. Our room was large and the furnishings well warn and tattered with peeling paint. The windows did not all open and one rattled when the wind blew until we put some card in it. The bed was creaky and soft. After staying in a very good Portland hotel just before this one for the same price it was a shock.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very European, great service”
Reviews.Author: scubagirl33
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! The room had a fireplace, very romantic. The location is also great and the breakfast to die for. We would certainly love to come back and stay here

Reviews.Title: “Charming and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: chrisnglenn
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the White Swan Inn, and I would highly recommend it. Our room was large and roomy, although for me, the bed was almost high enough I needed a step to get onto it! Pretty comfortable, though. The service was excellent and very prompt. The breakfast was scrumptious, with a different quiche every morning and a lovely selection of pastries to choose from. Much better than the make it yourself waffles at the Motel 6! :) I'm not sure I would stay here with kids, but my husband and I were traveling without ours, so we really couldn't judge. The staff was friendly and accomodating and I'm very much afraid this stay has spoiled me from now on! (Although Disney properties come close, they're not this level of service, at least not at the properties we've stayed at!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mbell20x
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous inn! Very close to cable car lines. Wonderful hot breakfast included in stay. Wine reception in evening lovely. Stayed with 2 small children under 4 and was accommodating. Very friendly staff. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, full of character”
Reviews.Author: Creamegg
Reviews.Content: As natives of England we were intrigued by the idea of staying in an English themed hotel. Well, itâ€™s not like anywhere that you would find in England, but it is a very nice hotel in its own right. The location is good, just a couple of streets down the hill from Grace Cathedral, and a ten minute walk up the hill from Union Square. Hills quickly become a theme in any trip to San Francisco! Our room was huge. It had a very large, comfortable bed complete with resident teddy bear, just in case yours is unable to travel. We also had a small kitchen area and a separate dressing room, with lots of space to hang clothes and generally spread out. We had a strong wifi signal in the room, which was free to use. The complimentary soft drinks in our in-room fridge were a nice touch, as was the wine reception each evening, allowing us to meet some very pleasant fellow guests. We felt that breakfast was a bit poor. There was a wide selection available, but items were not replenished very quickly and the quality of the sausages and burgers was not the best. Our only other issue was with noise late into the night from a nightclub on the Saturday of our stay, but the previous 3 nights had been fine and a bit of noise is to be expected in any city centre location. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, room needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: federalgirl
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel certainly has a charm to it. We're boutique hotel people, but The White Swan Inn made me wish we'd just gone with a larger dependable hotel chain. Our room was the petite suite in the back of the hotel--it has a lovely garden--a rare gem in the city for sure. Access to the room was private, but through the hotel and outside which was a pain. The room itself was spacious, and included a nice gas fireplace. The bathroom was also spacious. So the potential is certainly there. Unfortunately the furnishings were well worn and tattered. Paint was peeling in the bathroom, sink faucet handles broken, and everything just looked rather old and worn--not antique. The mattress was quite soft and uncomfortable, though I'm sure fine for some. Replacing a few pieces of furniture would go a long way to making this suite comfortable. I personally thought it was kind of "icky" at times. I have to say the staff was terrific--wonderfully accomodating and went the extra mile. The breakfast was great too. We ate next door at their sister hotel which had a larger breakfast room. Hopefully the standard rooms are better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallacethedog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2010 for 3 nights. Upon arrival they informed us that we were only booked for two nights, they checked the system and sorted everything out. After this all i can say is we had a fab stay. As first timers to San Fran we found that it was well located for Union Square, Grace Catherdral and lots of attractions. The staff are very friendly and helpful if you ask them where places are. The room we had was on the top floor at the rear of the property. The room itself was large with a very comfy bed. Being Scottish i appreciated the tartan bedcovers with the cushions and teddy bear. The rooom was lovely and warm and could not be falted. The only thing i did not like was that you could not move the shower head in the bathroom. The breakfast provided in the morning was great everything from porrigde to eggs. Plenty of food and the staff are always topping it up. At night they provide free wine and nibbles between 4.30( i think or it could have been 5.30pm.) The wine was realy nice and i found it a nice way to relax after spending all day outside on my feet. It was a little noisy at nighttime due to the traffic but i used earplugs so i slept like a log. Overall a great place to stay which i cannot recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “English house in the middle of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LoveZion
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the White Swan Inn. We were greeted on the first night with a very pleasing cheese and wine party. For the three nights we stayed, the wine was fabulous -- though the cheese was a bit more variable! We resorted to visiting the nearby Hidden Vine for some cheese and wine to help keep up our cheese quota. In any event, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to other travellers that are looking for a friendly and convenient location to visit San Francisco from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMsP
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay here for a week in San Francisco and were very happy. When we were stranded because of the volcano the hotel could not have been more helpful. They extended our booking until we were able to get a flight home. The fact that breakfast is included saved us a fortune and the evening wine was a really nice touch which allowed us to meet and socialise with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: alpine_eh
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at White Swan Inn in Feb, 2010. We would not go back for a week stay again. I have mixed feelings about the place.

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan is a charming, well located boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 2lingling
Reviews.Content: This is my home away from home when I come to San Francisco. It is cozy with a fireplace in each room, a good breakfast downstairs (including quiche, sausage, fresh fruit, hot oatmeal, juice and coffee - among the choices), and a wine gathering each afternoon - all included. It is located a few blocks from both Union Square, where you can find some of the best shopping in the world, and from historic China town. The hotel staff is friendly and willing to assist you in any way to make your stay enjoyable. They will provide you with a list of nearby recommended restaurants as well as help you plan a day of siteseeing. The White Swan is a Joie de Vie Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nice people, almost dodgy location but not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: shandyj
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel, we got a room with a fireplace on the ground floor and were impressed with the quality and size of the room - it was huge actually! The view from the window was of nothing much and would have been far better had we been at the front. The hotel had a traditional feel and was a great retreat after a days walking up and down hills. The staff were friendly and anything we required was provide in friendly, timely fashion. Breakfast was interesting - I've never eaten quiche for breakfast before - but enjoyable. For me, the location had positives and negatives, it's a couple of blocks up from the Tenderloin district which is dodgy, this means that some streets around the hotel have lots of homeless - this isn't uncommon in San Francisco, the place is full of homeless - most of whom appear to be borderline mental... or at least have a screw slightly loose. On the other hand, the hotel is close to anything you care to mention, although again - not uncommon in San Francisco as it's a small place. The Tenderloin does have it's upsides with some great bars, we really enjoyed visiting bourbon and branch which is a couple of blocks away (reservation required). An excellent restaurant near by was the R & G lounge and the edge of China Town - really good food. I didn't think the hotel was especially cheap but it is central in tourist city and the quality is high. Guess you get what you pay for at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Dsnylndqueen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, quaint hotel, it has a old time elevator with a lot of charm! We enjoy staying here due to the ambiance, there is a downstairs area, that reminds us of a old time gentlemans lounge, complete with a library, fireplaces, and even a old time globe. It is very relaxing to go in there during coctail hour, they have different wines, cheeses, fruit, and a dessert. While we were there it happened to be Easter, and they included colored eggs in the wonderful breakfast that is provided each morning. The rooms are very cozy, with a fireplace in each, beds are very comfortable, and bathrooms are antique. I very much enjoy our stay there when my husband and I go, and look forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “A unique San Francisco experience”
Reviews.Author: maygin58
Reviews.Content: Great Service - Unique Rooms in English Bed and Breakfast Style. I have stayed here twice - once with husband and returned with Sister. Conveniently located in the heart of the City near Union Square, Cable Cars and great restaurants. It is quiet - great staff - good breakfast - relaxing evenings with wine and hors d'oeuvres. Don't expect modern/sterile - this is a charming stay with character and warmth..... and one can experience San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel that I can highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: gabbyAthens_Ga
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn is a charming small hotel with a friendly and helpful staff in an excellent location for seeing San Francisco. My husband and I stayed in a king with fireplace. The room was large and clean and included a wet bar area with a small refrigerator which was kept stocked with water and soft drinks. The bed was very comfortable, even for my picky husband! The room was on the second floor facing the street and we had no problem with traffic noise. We thought the breakfast was excellent, including multiple options and variability over the three days. We only had time for the wine social once, and it was fine. The staff was very helpful. We were especially pleasantly surprised when my son decided to fly out to join us and they allowed him to stay in the room with us on the sofa bed (and eat breakfast,etc.) for no additional charge. We will not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: IAMPOTHOS
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the White Swan Inn when I travel to San Francisco for the past twenty years and I have never been disappointed. The hotel is well located within a short walk or cab ride to anywhere in the city. The staff is always courteous, helpful and knowledgable. The facility is kept clean and up to date, and the rooms are well appointed, comfortbale, spacious and quiet. I love getting my day started with the great breakfast served every morning and they also offer a nice snack in the evening. The rooms include water or sodas and internet. All the things other hotels nickel and dime you for are included here. The White Swan Inn can always be counted on for quality, value and a memorable and friendly experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary service in a charming locale.”
Reviews.Author: RRW44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three delightful nights at the White Swan Inn. It is charming small older hotel in a good location halfway between the top of Nob Hill and Union Square. The staff was uniformly friendly and went out their way to be helpful.. The included breakfast was firstt-rate and the afternoon wine well presented. The mini refrigerator is stocked with free water and soft drinks which is welcome relief from the usual overpriced hotel minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spring break in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Drummergirl15
Reviews.Content: We found the White Swan Inn on the internet. We were intrigued by it as we had traveled to the U.K. last summer and stayed in hotels such as this. It also seemed to be a good value compared to other places we have stayed in the area. We will definately stay here again when in San Francisco. The rooms was spacious and clean. The service was excellent. We anticipated the breakfast to be standard continental fare but found it to be much more than that. We attended the evening reception each night, meeting many interesting people from all over the world. One of our best trips to the Bay area!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is 1st Class”
Reviews.Author: mark13632
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we have stayed in for all of our vacations. It took about one minute to check in, and then they helped bring our luggage right to our room. The room was spacious, clean, and the decor matched the charm this vintage hotel. The fridge always had soda and waters for us. It was nice to have a good, hot breakfast (not a continental breakfast) each morning and the evening wine and hors dâ€™oeuvres were 1st class. The location is also great, being close to Chinatown, Union Station, and Financial District. The cable car is just two blocks away. Chris also arranged our airport shuttle and recommended a 5 star restaurant that was close and that we were able to get into on a Saturday night without reservations. The whole stay was wonderful and I can not think of one negative thing to say about our stay. We will be coming back next year and will be bring another couple with us.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful! A wonderful experience :)”
Reviews.Author: cjah
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the White Swan Inn. It is a charming, older hotel with a complementary decor. I chose this hotel based on the many positive reviews on tripadvisor.com. I was very happy to find that they were able to comfortably accommodate 3 guests in one room. One member of our group slept very well on a pull out sofa bed. Two of us slept in a wonderful king bed. This was my 3rd trip to San Francisco and the first hotel stay that was quiet and peaceful all night! The individuals who handled our check-in and check-out were courteous, friendly, and helpful. Complimentary cold soft drinks and water bottles were waiting in the room refrigerator. There was also an easy to use gas burning fireplace in our room! The delicious breakfast included with our stay included an egg casserole (quiche?), sausage, fresh fruit, hot oatmeal, 2 juices, and several other items. For our purposes, the location was perfect - we were within walking distance to many excellent stores and restaurants. Just wanted to mention that I booked my room directly with the hotel and the rate was comparable to rates I found online.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: jamaica6100
Reviews.Content: hospitable, lovely decor, lots of books, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously charming boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: hammiegirl
Reviews.Content: I came here with my spouse for my birthday weekend. We absolutely loved the stay here! The inn is older, but its charm makes up for it. We had one of the larger king rooms in the back of the hotel and found it quiet and comfortable. I loved having my own seperate vanity and large closet completely separate from the bathroom. It was so nice to have a staff who not only seemed to enjoy their jobs, but went out of their way to give us inside tips on how to best get around the city. The morning complimentary breakfast is the best I have had since staying in inns in Europe. The evening wine and cheese is not to be missed - it was not only delicous, but we made friends with many of the other inn guests from around the globe and had so much fun sharing our stories about our day in SF. I room did end up having a water leak during one night from the bathroom upstairs, but it was quickly attended to by the staff ASAP in the morning. We will most definitely be returning for a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathrynzack
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the White Swan Inn. The staff was helpful, pleasant and i would say even, 'charming'. The food was outstanding and offered a wide range to chooose from. Everything was clean, frig was nice and the fireplace even better. The location was fabulous. We made it easily to the bus stop and taxi's were also available. The friendly staff was the highlight. They ran out to meet us, unpacked our car and then took the car and parked it. They were also welcoming to families. We would stay there again and again! There is nothing that we didn't like. Loved it! KSZ

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find and value”
Reviews.Author: ravtrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a meeting at a "convention hotel". Everyone welcomes you like family. Breakfast is a delight, and, if you like old English lots of floral decor, it's a fun place as well. There is a wine, cheese, appetizer and sweets reception daily, and cookies and coffee out all the time. Our room was old but fine for five days and included a fireplace. When our heat didn't work, they provided an electric heater. Elevator is a challenge for the faint-hearted but an adventure for everyone else. We would stay there again happily and feel at home (maybe even better). Note for the five star crowd but we loved it as did friends who stayed there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: ChristineA3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful antiques...nice evening snacks and wine...delicious morning buffet...beatiful rooms, great service and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy. The breakfast was so good. I'd go back just for that!”
Reviews.Author: OpenBloke
Reviews.Content: The room was really nice. Very cozy. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. The inn was located smack in the middle of town so very good location. The breakfast was so good. The bread and butter pudding was the best i've ever had. Over all it really didnt feel like we were in the middle of a busy city. Was just so cozy and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treasure”
Reviews.Author: mkm10
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the White Swan Inn for anyone traveling to The City. It is a cozy, friendly, establishment within easy walking to Union Square, Chinatown, Financial District and the Powell St. cable car stop...the perfect location. The complimentary breakfast and evening wine were a bonus. MKM Aurora, Co

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: auburntraveler84
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the White Swan Inn was helpful and friendly from the moment we walked in until we left. Upon our arrival, we found out we had been upgraded to a King Suite, and the room was great. Lots of room, very comfortable, fireplace, complimentary drinks in the fridge, books to read, and a separate sink outside the bathroom. I enjoyed the flowered wallpaper and felt it added to the charm of the hotel. The location is perfect. Just a few blocks from the trolley line and easy walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown and even the Pier. The front desk people were helpful with suggestions of how to get around, where to eat and what to do. I loved the fresh baked cookies in the lobby and it was nice to have a real breakfast instead of just rolls and fruit. Would definitely recommend staying here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great business trip room with a B&B feel”
Reviews.Author: mtloucks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second consecutive year and things were above my expectations. New TVs were an upgrade from last year. The walk to Union Square for my work meeting was short. The breakfasts are a great start to the day. The work-out room is small, but the weather is nice enough in SF that you can run outside anyway. I'm not sure what the WiFi situation is, but I needed to do more reading for work than any computer work. All in all, a nice change from the chain hotels, a great price, a great breakfast and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Relaxing Hotel in the Heart of Downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: 3Tibetans
Reviews.Content: The White Swan is conveniently located right near Union Square and some great restaurants. The staff was warm and friendly. They had complimentary evening wine and breakfast in their large sitting room which has lots of small comfortably furnished alcoves. The clean room is very old fashioned San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, would return again!!”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at this hotel...love the rooms with the fireplace, very cozy. Beds and bedding are very comfortable. This is an older hotel, but that's what we like...alot of character...Breakfast is wonderful, and included....many options. Staff is very friendly and helpful...great recommedations for restaurants..Locations is the best...walked to Union Square in less than 10 minutes...we will be back next year for sure...love this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, loved White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: kelly47
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, sweet, and charming hotel. I loved the fireplace in the room and was a great location right on Nob Hill. I had a great time and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. I would definately recommend this hotel to a friend, especially couples.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, lovely, enjoyable and fun”
Reviews.Author: CL1978
Reviews.Content: We must have been at least 20 years younger than the average resident and this is a very granny like hotel, but we loved it. After staying in boutique hotels in many major cities, we found this place a very nice change. The rooms are huge and funny, the bed is super comfortable. We loved it and would stay here again if we ever find our way back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel is back!”
Reviews.Author: TouristSeattle
Reviews.Content: We always looked forward to visiting San Francisco because we had discovered the best boutique hotels- Petite Aumberge and White Swan Inn. We stayed there for years then learned that there had been changes and they had closed. In December 2009 we found that they were open with a new ownership and the White Swan had a room available-we jumped at the chance. The room, breakfast, common spaces and great cookies in the lobby were just as we remembered them-excellent! Our fireplace and the complimentary wine and snacks in the afternoon are wonderful touches.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SACALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times and always enjoy it immensely. It is well located just a few blocks from the cable line and Union Square shopping. It is small and tasteful. We always ask for a room with a fireplace. The rooms are spacious. Breakfast is included and is always delicious and different each morning The other guests are often European or people on business who appreciate the small size, personal attention and wonderful location. We love the White Swan.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find...”
Reviews.Author: Chaseman
Reviews.Content: This was a great little boutiqe hotel less than 2 blocks from the Powell Cable Car line and about 3 blocks from all the Union Square shopping. The rooms are nicely apointed and large enough for a sitting area but best of all was the in-room fireplace. The serve a delightful wine happy hour and great continential breakfast. will definately return and recomend. Remember that this is an old hotel so do not expect a doorman and express elevator. Steff was VERY helpful and courtious.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: pparvin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco and had a wonderful stay at the White Swan Inn. The location is perfect for catching the cable car and walking to Union Square and many restaurants. The staff was very accommodating with reservations and the food (breakfast and afternoon wine and appetizers.) was superb. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We had an Absolutely Wonderful stay at the White Swan Inn!”
Reviews.Author: SavanaDublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were coming to San Francisco to attend a holiday party in early December. From the recommendation of my sister and her husband, we chose to stay at the White Swan Inn. My brother in law, who is British, felt much at home at this English themed inn. They had nothing but wonderful things to say about this inn....and my husband and I fully concur! We were delighted by the lovely decor, warm fires roaring throughout the hotel and in our room, as well as the warm reception from the front desk staff. We brought our car, along, but we had a great experience with the valet service...getting our car was quick and easy to use. Our room was immaculate and well appointed with many special touches that you don't find in a regular hotel, including darling teddy bears on the large comfortable bed. We had the best time at the complimentary breakfast the next morning. The selection of freshly baked pastries, fresh fruit, and egg dishes were delicious and beautifully displayed. We were very impressed with the quality, quantity, variety, and presentation of all of the food. By the way, the coffee was execellent..as well as a great variety of lovely teas and hot chocoloates. The breakfast was served in a warm dining area, with french doors opening up to quaint garden courtyard. Right below the dining area is a welcoming large sitting area and also french doors into a darling library and sitting area where a warm fire was burning. The great part of staying at the hotel was that it is within walking distance of Union Square and Nob Hill. My husband and I were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go, without having to use our car or hire a taxi. The whole experience at the White Swan Inn was wonderful and I think we'll make it an annual trip each December to enjoy all of the holiday splendor and lights at the hotel, Union Square, as well as all of San Francisco. It is a magical city!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jlucas1016
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending Thanksgiving week in San Francisco to visit our son who lives there and stayed at the White Swan Inn. I can't say enough about the hotel. Our room was terrific (very large) and the hotel has a wonderful atmosphere with fireplaces everywhere. Breakfast was great (and lots of food) which kept us going until evening. The wine hour was a nice touch (not fabulous, but so what). The staff were incredibly helpful and the location can't be beat. We bought a 3-day MUNI pass and were able to go all over the City very easily. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Michael091
Reviews.Content: In all of our travels, our stay at the White Swan Inn, San Francisco, was perfect. The staff was always extremely attentative and helpful. The hotel's ambience surpasses all others. Beautifully appointed rooms with antiques, fireplaces and lots of extra ammenities. The Inn is centrally located to all important SF sites. Everytime we have the opportunity to be in SF, we will always stay at the White Swan Inn. Price for value cannot be beat. I honestly cannot think of a thing that would have made our stay better.

Reviews.Title: “terrific- just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: cshaw77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - good location, reasonable prices and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Fun/Different/Quirky/Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Mark
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in larger chained hotels, so this was a bit of a diversion for us! I'm actually a Travel Agent so we often stay in Fairmont properties, so we were interested in what we would think of this! It's unique - we loved the elevator! It's old, it rattles, but it's so much fun - those free cookies were lovely, and we should have taken the stairs, but that Elevator was too exciting to turn down! The hotel is extremely quaint, full of character, they have tried to create an English B&B feeling and done it very well (we're originally from the UK). Room was bigger than we expected, nice to have a fireplace that could be turned on and off with a switch by the bed, talking of the bed, amazing comfort levels that gave us great night's sleep. The breakfast was fresh, good choice, nice surroundings - and the ladies working down there didn't stop replenishing the food, so everything was always fresh. Great location, close to downtown, we thought it was better staying here than in the Fisherman's Wharf area. The staff there are very friendly, always smiling, and gave us some fabulous advice on where to eat - they took an interest on what we had done for that day, and where we had eaten, as they seem pass this on the future guests. Don't expect Room Service, a Swimming Pool, or Air Conditioning - but what you hopefully will feel is the unique character of the hotel, including it's rooms, and the nice friendly levels of service that all the staff offer - and like us, have of the best night's sleep we have had in a hotel! We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT INN - GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mississaugamiss
Reviews.Content: After reading through Trip Advisor early in the year, we decided to book White Swan Inn for a conference being held in San Francisco for October 09. We arrived late at night and first impression of the neighbourhood wasn't great. However, by the light of day it was fine and as we found our way around, it was certainly central to everywhere we wanted to go. We had a large bedroom, with a dressing room, which was great for getting out early in the morning. The room was well appointed, clean and well kept. We enjoyed the breakfasts, as again it saved time getting out in the morning. The quality of the food was excellent and the surroundings the same. The location was close to the cable car and also Union Square. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to San Francisco and the stay at White Swan with its excellent staff made the event even more enjoyable. We would recommend this hotel to others, as it was not a cookie cutter hotel and the rates were good.

Reviews.Title: “Hate "English Inns" but White Swan won us over!”
Reviews.Author: Twohoppers
Reviews.Content: I don't usually like english-style inns (at least in the US). Don't like floral wallpaper. Don't like antique carpet. Somehow, we ended up loving our experience at the White Swan. We took a chance based on Tripadvisor, along with a very good special that Joie de Vivre hotels was offering - yes, the White Swan is part of a boutique chain, but quite unlike most of its (more modern) sister hotels. I agree with most previous reviewers about its great staff, convenient location, good-sized rooms (for San Francisco), good breakfasts, fresh-baked cookies every day (a different varieties, and definitely not from a tub of cookie dough), free soft drinks, fireplace in our room, and our wi-fi did work throughout our stay! What won us over was the "total package" of the White Swan with its unique charm, slight quirkiness, as well as its imperfections! We didn't want the overly personal attention of a small B & B, but also not the blandness of a large modern hotel. We felt we could retain some privacy, yet also felt welcome to socialize with other guests - both were perfectly okay here. We could tell that the staff genuinely liked working there by their friendly pride, the way they interacted with guests and more importantly - they way they treated each other. We felt so comfortable - at home, yet well taken care of - the hallmark of a great hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lianawa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Swan Inn for three nights in early Nov. We were a little apprehnsive when we arrived the stairs and the lift werea bit of a cchallenge however we warmed tothe quirkyness and really enjoyed our stay. My husband had trouble will his internat connection and Darren from the front desk was really helpfull in getting t sorted for him. The room was clean trhe bed comforatable and the location was excellent. Also having a seperated 'dressing room' was fabulous. There is no airconditioning so if you are prone to getting a bit warm then that may be a problem but this hotel is reasonably priced, clean and really well located. However it ias not a modern big flash hotel but we warmed to it and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Guest House”
Reviews.Author: TheScribelers
Reviews.Content: Quirky room, excellent bed. Room only let down by out dated shower. Breakfast and afternoon wine & nibbles create a really friendly atmosphere in which to meet fellow travelers. The whole feel is of a English Guest House. Complementary soft drink in fridge in room very welcome after a day exploring. Location quite central with the entrance to Chinatown at the bottom of the inevitable hill. You'll love your stay at the White Swan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “White Swan Inn: Confused About Their Target Customers”
Reviews.Author: NCtourist
Reviews.Content: The White Swan is a decidedly mixed bag. On the one hand, their luxury king rooms are spacious with a fireplace and dressing room (see pictures). There are complementary beverages in the refrigerator. The desk clerks were polite and helpful. The evening wine and cheese is a lovely touch (although cole slaw was a definite first for an accompaniment -perhaps that's an English thing :) The breakfast buffet includes a variety of foods to meet most tastes but the servers are very slow to replenish items -including the coffee--and on two of the three mornings we were there were late to put the items out at all. The hotel lacks air conditioning so be forewarned that if San Francisco is experiencing warm weather, as it was when we were there, you will roast in you room. A fan is provided but the choice remains -street noise or uncomfortable warmth. The hotel is conveniently located but lacks a porter to assist with bags on arrival and there is no way around the stairs at the entry. This is not a hotel for people with impaired mobility. The Victorian decor is pleasant enough but the towels and bath amenities are more suited to a budget motel than a "boutique hotel". On one morning, the maid left no washcloths at all in our room. That seemed to exemplify the spotty nature of the service at the hotel. Sometimes great, sometimes awful. All in all, my husband and I agreed that this hotel is confused about its target market.

Reviews.Title: “Charming or just tired?”
Reviews.Author: particleboardpigeon
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of the glowing reviews describing the White Swan as a charming little inn. I'm afraid it's just tired and in need of a serious scrubbing and updating. The location is pretty good and within walking distance of Chinatown and Union Square. It seems safe at night in the surrounding areas. The staff was friendly and helpful. The downstairs area - where breakfast and afternoon receptions are held is homey. I appreciated the afternoon receptions, which provide coffee, wine, grapes, cheeses, crackers, and cookies. Unfortunately, you have no control over the temperature, old carpets, peeling paint, a bathroom that needs a serious renovation, a front door handle that feels like it could be ripped off the door with a slight tug, and ...what is that charming smell? Others gushed over the breakfasts. I've come to expect better from a Hampton Inn. I really wanted to like the place, but I just don't. I've often been pleasantly surprised by the small inns and B&Bs we've been to in the past. But, I won't be back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: Kellym9293
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a convenient location and the staff were really friendly. The rooms are really cute and are very comfortable. The fridge is stocked with complimentary soda and water - which is really nice after a long day of touring the city. The breakfast in the morning had plenty of items to choose from and was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing people and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: DWhig
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful experience and I would recommend it highly! Beautiful room and very attentive staff. And to top it off, a wonderful breakfast every morning included in the stay. The entire expereince may you feel welcome, plus give you the opportunity to meet and greet with the other guests. A great way to find do's and don't of sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat!!”
Reviews.Author: Burmis
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and adult daughter stayed in the Ashley Suite for 3 nights in September. We checked in early, but were welcomed by extremely friendly staff, who made our room available - and so it continued for the whole 3 days - nothing was too much trouble for the staff of this hotel. The rooms, although a little dark and even gloomy, were very comfortable. We enjoyed separate bathrooms and kitchenettes in our suite, the water pressure was fantastic, the amenities in the bathroom were of the highest quality. The breakfast, which consisted of fresh fruit, hot porridge, cereal, eggs, bacon, sausages, toast, etc, was superb, as was the 5.30pm "happy hour" when the hotel provided complimentary red and white wine and nibbles for the guests to enjoy whilst sitting in their comfortable armchairs in front of the fire, chatting about their experiences. Coffee, tea and cocoa were available in the dining area at any time of the day, and fresh cookies daily in the lobby. We were completely ruined for subsequent stays in other hotels, they just didn't measure up to the White Swan - can absolutely recommend this lovely hotel for their care and attention to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kurokuroneko
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay in the city. Minutes from Union Square. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The dining area is a cozy and relaxing place to enjoy a cup of tea. My only disappointment with this inn is the breakfast. Labelled as "gourmet", but did not achieve such status. The kitchen staff is friendly, but food is restocked slowly. Scrambled eggs, sausage and quiche along with muffins and some pastries. Yoghurt upon request. The food was ok but not inspiring. The room was clean and spacious. Front desk people are very cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: WinnerMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during out trip about California in May 2009. The room was quite big and comfortable with a gas fireplace. As San Francisco is the city where you can do a lot of walking, we found this place very well and centrally located. Breakfast was good and tasty but took us some time: during â€œrush morning hoursâ€� we had to wait for the employees to re-fill the plates at the buffet. But this waiting was quite pleasant as weâ€™ve been on vacation and not in a hurry anyway. We loved the service â€“ the receptionists were all very helpful and supportive. All in all I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollyElli
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on our honeymoon and it was one of the loveliest hotels we have ever stayed in. The staff was fantastic, the room great, and we loved the breakfast and the afternoon wine reception. Would recommend it to anyone, especially if you prefer a small and intimate hotel rather than one of the big chains! Booked it through Hotels.com and only payed about Â£60 for a King Suite which was a very big room with a seating area and a fireplace, great value for your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Jaknefesh
Reviews.Content: Unlike my friend, I prefer more modern properties. However, I was delightfully surprised at the charm of this property, cleanliness and friendliness of staff. We loved the old Otis elevator that brought us to our floor and the English Country charm. Staff was helpful when we needed directions. Also, the breakfast that changes daily and the afternoon "Happy Hour" saved us in food purchases. The location was not far from transportation. We learned to take the cable car up the last steep hill. We'd definitely stay here on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room, helpful staff, inc. breakfast and p.m. snacks”
Reviews.Author: BevLB
Reviews.Content: Located between Union Sq & Nob Hill. Our room was large with sitting area. Place feels like a British B&B. Great breakfast selections. Serves tea, cake, wine, crackers in afternoon. 2 blks from cable car and 4 blks from bus #30 which provides access to most major sites. Staff is very helpful. Hotel is in a hilly area on a busy street. Room was quiet with windows closed but noisy when windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshment, Relaxation, and Sweet Rest”
Reviews.Author: Rebedla
Reviews.Content: After the "escape from Hurricane Rita" drive from Monterey to San Francisco on a Sunday in July, my husband and I arrived at the White Swan Inn in need of some refreshment, relaxation and sweet rest. All three were provided by the hospitality of the staff, afternoon wine and cheese and the comfort of our surroundings and room at the White Swan Inn. The Inn was recommended by a friend and it was everything she said it would be and more. Being able to lie on the bed and flip a switch to light the fireplace across the room was the "icing on the cake." Eric, Mary, and their incredible staff made our stay at the White Swan Inn truly enjoyable. Thanks for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, charming inn with great rooms and food”
Reviews.Author: redmonty
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn attempts to replicate an old English country house - sometimes this results in comically over the top decorations and unnecessarily rickety features (like the elevator) but despite these eccentricities the Inn is fabulously comfortable. The free breakfast was delicious and homely (though could have had a little more variety from one day to the next) and the rate also included a wine reception each afternoon. The rooms were spacious, with a comfortable 4-poster bed and romantic fireplace. Would recommend as a romantic place to stay in san francisco, but please don't think this is what England is really like!

Reviews.Title: “White Swan Inn is a treasure”
Reviews.Author: WickfordAudrey
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn is in a terrific location (just outside Union Square and Chinatown) and is a charming respite in a bustling city. Besides being reasonably priced, a delicious breakfast is included in the cost, as well as complimentary red & white wine and an assortment of hors d'oeuvres in the evening! They also always have coffee and tea available with a different homemade treat each day! What's better than that? My mother and I stayed there for 3 nights in August. My only complaint would be that our room was not air-conditioned and our room was on the street. It was hot one night and noisy all three. Ear plugs did the trick for me. They did give us a good fan that muffled the sound and did cool off the room pretty well. Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful, too. All in all, I hope I have the opportunity to return one day...I'll just request a room in the back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ducklander
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find. The White Swan is a great respite in the center of the city. Just a block from the cable cars, a short walk to shopping at Union Square, the location is terriffic. Staff was pleasant, helpful and courteous. The room was large and cozy; the fireplace came in handy on a cool evening. The bed was large and super comfy. We enjoyed the wine tasting and the breakfast was great - filling with plenty of tasty options. Complimentary beverages in the in-room mini-fridge was a nice bonus. Family friendly and a great value - what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect comfort and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: miriamNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The room was large, beautifully kept, with a nice gas fire, sitting area, window seat! and large bed. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The lounge a wonderful place to sit and talk or read, great snacks and wine for a happy hour. I recommend the place highly. Miriam

Reviews.Title: “Feelin Special”
Reviews.Author: FloridaCursillista
Reviews.Content: If you ever wanted to feel truly special or like a distinguished guest, stay at the White Swan Inn. Everyone makes you feel like you are his or her only guest staying there. The restaurants they recommend are to be tried because they know what they are talking about. All I can say is you will LOVE staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: vm1949
Reviews.Content: Staying at the White Swan was a delightful experience. The room was very clean, large, and well decorated in a European style. Bed was comfortable and the fireplace a bonus. The first floor area provides a great setting for the wine tasting and a full buffet breakfast which was a surprise given the wide variety of foods and the quality. That area is decorated like a library or den with lots of wood, fireplaces, comfortable chairs and sofas as well as a selection of board games or books to curl up with. Outdoor seating on a patio is available.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fantastic boutique hotel conveniently located near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JudettePerth
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the White Swan Inn with my sister and another girlfriend. We stayed in the Ashleigh Suite and it was very comfortable, big and cosy. The staff were very friendly and helpful particularly when my sister had tripped while on a visit to see the Redwood trees and when she hobbled into the room there was a knock on the door and the reception staff appeared with band aids, scissors, tape etc. They serve drinks every afternoon in the parlour and it is a chance to meet other guests and exchange tips for sightseeing etc. We ended up going out to dinner with some of the other guests and had a great night out. Breakfast is very good and plentiful. There are lots of great eating places walking distance from the hotel. I would definitely stay there again if I go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to spendfour nights in the great city of San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Rontack
Reviews.Content: I visited San Francisco with my wife and older daughter from May 27-31, 2009 and we had the privilege of staying at the White Swan during that time. The purpose of the trip was to attend a Seminar at the Hotel Nikko( We preferred to stay at the White Swan rather than the host hotel). We were very pleased with the service we received during our stay. First and foremost ,Andy went out of his way to assist us. We have known Andy for many years, having stayed at the Petite Aurberge many times over many years. We were also treated very well by Eno, Anne and Brian. They were all wonderful and we feel all of these wonderful employees are assets to the hotel. The hospitality of the White Swan is superior. The rooms are very attractive and comfortable. We enjoyed the food. We are looking forward to visiting San Francisco next May and plan on staying at either The White Swan or Petite Auberge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Business or Leisure.”
Reviews.Author: JAJ1980
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two teenage children spent two nights at The White Swan on a vactation to the Bay area in May, 2009. We loved the quaint European-style suite we had with fireplaces in each room and period decor. The rates were very reasonable, and the complementary breakfast and wine reception were great. My kids loved it. Both before and after our arrival, the staff could not have been more helpful to us with restaurant reservations and general tourist advice. The hotel is perfectly situated near Union Square, China Town and the Cable Car line. I will not look any further than the White Swan the next time in I'm in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms w/fireplaces, free breakfast & pm wine & food, knowledgable friendly staff the best in San Frrancisco.”
Reviews.Author: travel10020
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at The White Swan Inn many times and each stay has been wonderful. Rooms are large and comfortable, with antiques and books sprinkled throughout the room. Staff wonderful with grace and expertise. Bed was so comfortable I wanted to take the mattress home, but it would not fit in my luggage. Wonderful total relaxing experience, from the food, to the staff, to the furnishings, to the location. Highly recommend. A+++++++++++. Original recommendation for us to come to The White Swan Inn was thru our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Magnum409
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of spending three days at the White Swan Inn in San Francisco in early June. What a great place!! It's a small, quaint hotel tucked into one of the side streets in the downtown area. Easily within walking distance to the trolley lines and hundreds of shops and restaurants. All of the staff were very pleasant and very helpful in getting directions or making recommendations for things to see or do. This hotel more closely resembles a bed and breakfast than it does a hotel, and it has the charm of a place from an earlier era. If you're not into the take a number, large hotel scene, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “WE REALLY LOVED OUR STAY AT THE WHITE SWAN INN”
Reviews.Author: DeeGirl_02
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco. Staying at the White Swan Inn made it a very pleasant vacation! The room was very lovely and comfortable. We loved the fireplace and the coziness of the room. The staff was nice and very helpful. We enjoyed the lovely breakfast and evening wine. Would return to the White Swan Inn if ever in San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan feels like a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: KCAnglophile
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth visit to the White Swan Inn. It is a great place to use as home base while you are exploring San Francisco. The rooms are comfortable and generously sized, the full breakfast buffet delicious, and little touches like wine and snacks at 5 p.m., tea at all hours, and freshly made cookies in the lobby cookie jar always make my stay enjoyable. I also enjoy being able to walk to Union Square, Chinatown, and even North Beach. At this point, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else on my trips to San Francisco-- unless they were fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Jakeaz
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the top floor and was very well appointed with great linens and well stocked refrig and bath. We has two vanity areas which was handy. Staff were very friendly and helpful, including logging into our airline to check us in for our flight while we were sightseeing. Wine hour and breakfast were delicious. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel for a perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MOrgan153
Reviews.Content: We had a mini family reunion with folks staying in four rooms of your wonderful hotel and we loved everything about it. We each thought we had the best room. The breakfasts (four of them) were fantastic, the cookies and coffee anytime were wonderful and the wine and hors d'oevres were great. We spent mornings and afternoons walking and taking the cable cars all over the city and then came back late afternoon and played cards, either in the breakfast room or on the back deck. Everything was perfect. The staff was so helpful and nice. Thank you for a perfect trip. We are already planning our next trip to San Francisco so we can stay at the White Swan Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchie48
Reviews.Content: Do you like old style, close to so many things........ this is the place to go. The breakfast is lovely. The wine and cheese in the afternoon is fantastic. You have a chance to mingle with other guests and find out where they have been, exchange ideas, find out about the best places in Town. There are some wonderful restaurants within walking distance, and you are just a block from the cable car.

Reviews.Title: “GIRLFRIEND GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: Girlfriends05
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, charming inn for a weekend with the girls (although my husband and I have stayed here before and loved it). We had the two rooms in the front of the inn with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, fireplaces in both and wet bars. The staff is very accomodating, the breakfast is awesome, and it is close to everything in Union Square. So much nicer than a nondescript hotel room in some big chain hotel. The rooms are decorated with antiques and wallpaper; lovely four-poster beds, nice bathrooms. What's not to love? We will all be back!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Melanieann
Reviews.Content: We just had a lovely week stay at this Inn. I assure you that you are in for a treat! Our check-in was great in the the very cozy lobby with the fireplace glowing. Up the old fashioned lift to our little hide-a-way. Very English cottage, large living space with bathroom with deep tub, dressing room and wet bar in a small alcove. Nice ironed linens on comfy bed. The breakfasts were great and varied. Good coffee too! Wine and cheese great to have in front of fire in the evening. This is the place..hated to leave. Would go back in a moment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay -- I Plan to Return!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMaureen
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the White Swan Inn. My room was large, with a very comfortable bed (complete with teddy bear), spacious sitting and desk/work areas and a working gas fireplace (great for those rainy February days in SF). Great to have coffee, tea and free sodas and water in the room.. The included breakfast was fantastic -- delicious hot breakfast food (quiches, sausage), breads, fruit, etc. The daily evening wine and cheese reception was also great. Nice sitting area (with more fireplaces) downstairs. Very centrally located. Staff was pleasant and helpful. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Service!”
Reviews.Author: LindaSeattle
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the White Swan Inn/San Francisco for two nights in March. The Inn is decorated in an "Olde English" style theme. Wallpaper on the walls, floral prints on the rugs/carpets and little touches of home everywhere. The fireplaces located in the rooms and sitting rooms add to the coziness of the Inn. As soon as you enter the lobby, you feel at home. The staff are all helpful, and well informed. There is a jar of fresh baked cookies available all day in the lobby area. The complimentary breakfast is outstanding - Fresh baked bread, a variety of pastries, hard boiled eggs, fruit, oatmeal, sausage, quiche and cereals are arranged in a pleasing display. Wine hour consists of crackers, cheese, veggies and a homemade bundt cake/pound cake. Our room (#56) was of good size. The bedding is clean and comfortable. The sofa bed is not very comfortable. The location is on Nob Hill which is a little far from the main tourist attractions if you are walking. We were very pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franktrav
Reviews.Content: A unique experience. Reminded me of the out of the way hotels found in Europe. Deligthtful and quaint. The staff was all so friendly. The room was very tastefully furnished and the bed mattress was like sleeping on a cloud. The evening wine and cheese and the breakfast were very nicely done. Am looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect! Charming, Romantic, Relaxing, Roomy.”
Reviews.Author: teacher_from_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: This is a phenomenal place: it's gorgeous, well maintained, romantic, private, and convenient. We just can't say enough good things about it. A fireplace in every room, complimentary goodies in the fridge, complimentary wifi in every room, comfy robes... Just fantastic! Outside the rooms, there is a lounge for relaxing by the fire with wine and cheese in the afternoons, not to mention coffee, hot chocolate, daily newspapers all on hand for you. And the staff--wow! From the moment we were booking the hotel over the phone, to our arrival and stay, to our departure, we were treated as VIP's. They accommodated us in every way we asked--and beyond: they knew it was our anniversary, so we were greeted with champagne and chocolates (complimentary), and we felt immediately in the right place. We loved it so much that for some of our dinners, we just "ate in," sitting in front of the fireplace in our room in the very comfy chairs, soaking up the warmth and reflecting on our day out and about in the city. What a wonderful trip to SF, and much of the credit goes to the White Swan. I do hope their staff is paid well; they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Charming & Darling B&B feel, superb service, a must stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie03
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find! I definately recommend this charming and quaint B&B to everyone. Delicious breakfast and evening wine/appitizers and fresh baked goodies everyday! Staff very accomodating. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel, near synagogue”
Reviews.Author: joycew
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 5 night stay at the White Swan Inn. It is in a great location in Nob Hill and a few blocks from Union Square, Chinatown, the cable cars, and many buses. My husband had a conference to attend everyday and I found it easy to explore the city from this location. The rooms had fireplaces and were large and spacious and located on 5 floors with an elevator. We had the Ashley Suite which was a two room suite which consisted of a bedroom having a canopy bed, sitting area, fireplace, bathroom, wet bar with refrigerator, TV and it faced the courtyard. The other room faced the front street and had another bathroom, closet, living room with TV, couch, club chair, desk, lounge chair, and another wet bar with refrigerator and coffee maker. Bathrobes were provided for lounging. There was complimentary water, soft drinks and champagne in the refrigerator along with a box of chocolates and chocolates on the bed at turn down. There was always fruit and cookies or cake at the front desk area. Included with your stay is breakfast and afternoon tea with appetizers. Breakfast is served downstairs in a nice area that opens onto the courtyard when the weather is warmer. Breakfast consists of cold cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, pastries, scrambled eggs quiche, breakfast meats, oatmeal, coffee, tea, and juices. Afternoon tea is served in the adjoining den areas which have comfy couches, wing backed chairs and fireplaces. There is wine, cordials, coffee, tea, cookies or cake, fruit and cheese, something hot like artichoke dip or lasagna or salad. In addition to the china cups and saucers by the coffee and hot water pot, there are also paper cups with covers for those "on the go". Since we keep kosher, we only had the juice, fruit and cold cereal, but everyone said the food was good. For shabbat, we were able to go to shul at the oldest orthodox shul in the city, Congregation Kenneset Israel on Sutter Streeet, which is only about 3-4 blocks away. You can make arrangements to have dinner and lunch there for shabbat. A few blocks away at the entrance to Chinatown near the arch there is a kosher restaurant, Sabra, which serves good middle eastern food. The Inn also has a small exercise room which has a treadmill and bicycle with a TV to watch while exercising. A computer is also in this room ($5.00 for 20 minutes) . There are plenty of brochures about area attractions at the front desk and the staff is very courteous and helpful. This is a great place to stay if you are looking for something other than the cookie cutter large hotels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: JLeland
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel was only a short walk from Union Square and the location was very convenient. The staff was especially friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was spacious, comfortable and filled with light, and the fireplace added a wonderful romantic touch. The breakfast was excellent and featured homemade baked goods, and we enjoyed the little treats that were available in the lobby throughout the day. We'd stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, comfort all in middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: seadoyles
Reviews.Content: We LOVED White Swan! The service was exceptional (kudos to Brendan and Kevin), the rooms so spacious and complete, housekeeping staff thorough and honest (thanks to them a few missed items found their way back to me). We loved the beds and linen! They offer a full and delicious breakfast, an evening happy hour with yummy hordeurves and wine not to mention friendly setting to share experiences with fellow travelers. The location is perfect, just a quick walk up hill to enjoy the quieter neighborhood setting. Such old world elegance... We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “If you dont stay hear you'll wish you would have”
Reviews.Author: LanaFletcher
Reviews.Content: This was such a lovley place, The employees are very friendly and very helpfull. It was such a beautiful room and a big change to the large hotels. We have been to San Francisco 3 times in the kast year and this was the best place for us . Definately take advantage of the great breakfast & the wine and tasty snaks in the afternoon. Also really centrally located . Thanks for A great time

Reviews.Title: “felt welcomed”
Reviews.Author: bluelightning
Reviews.Content: I recently spent several days at this wonderful hotel/B&B. The staff made a big effort to accommodate my family's requests about finding off the beaten path things to do. We felt comfortable and safe. The breakfast buffet and evening appetizers were tasty and plentiful. The location is great as well. It is a short stroll to Chinatown and Union Square. The rest of San Francisco could easily be reached by convenient, efficient, public transportation. It is a good value with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: eanj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swan Inn for nine nights in November 2008. Our room was spacious and very cheerful as flowers greeted our arrival. The small but efficient elevator was reminiscent of hotels through out Europe and added great charm. Breakfast was an occasion to be enjoyed. Every item was delicious from the fresh prepared quiche, sausage, bacon, potatoes and fresh fruit. The rolls and crossiants were always fresh and plentiful. An assortment of dry cereal and cooked cereal was available as was orange and cranberry juice. The atmosphere was friendly and guests enjoyed visiting with each other. The homemade cookies that were always available in the lobby were an added treat. But, the best for last. The evening wine and Hors d'Oeuvres were excellent and provided a wonderful opportunity to meet and fellowship with fellow travelers. Friendships we made include people from London, Sweden, Australia, Washington DC, New York and on and on. The staff added to a wonderful experience and we would highly recommend staying at the White Swan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: rockymountainhighUK
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in a number of hotels recommended by Tripadvisor.com, but this just did not live up to the reviews. Given Room 25 on the ground floor, very dark as it overlooked walls, decoration very drab and tired, paint peeling, definitely did not look like the pictures on the website. Commented to the front desk the next evening and was immediately upgraded to Room 57. As I was leaving for dinner I packed my bags and was advised everything would be moved by the time I returned and a complimentary bottle of champagne would be provided. On my return around 22:00 nothing had been moved. Went to front desk and moved myself with assistance from front desk staff. No champagne but this was quickly rectified. Very disappointing experience. Room 57 was lovely, did look like the pictures on the website and was very comfortable. Breakfasts excellent. Breakfast room lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A charming inn, well located”
Reviews.Author: greybees
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Inn for four nights in January, 2009. The White Swan is centrally located in the city and quite charming with large, cheery rooms with flowery wallpaper. The beds are large and comfortable. It has an early 20th century elevator that is a delight to use. A dining area (breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese) and adjacent library are handsomely decorated. The service is most friendly and efficient. But, as with most hotels, there are some negatives. The bathrooms are small and stark. The TV's are aged and the cable system attached can be a frustrating nightmare to use. There are no temperature controls in the rooms and opening the windows only increases the noise volume coming from the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: organictraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night/4 day trip to San Francisco as a mother/daughter get away. The room was perfect for 2 women trying to get ready. It was a nice size room with 2 twin beds. The sheets definitely need upgraded, but I was told that will be completed soon. There is a nice size vanity/sitting area/dressing table with a sink and plenty of room to hang clothes and store luggage. There is a small sink in the bathroom and yet a 3rd sink in a small cubicle size area with a coffee maker and small fridge. The complimentary ice water in the fridge is something that is practically unheard of these days. These separate areas made it really nice for us to be doing different things when in the room. While my daughter chose to sleep in in the mornings, I enjoyed the breakfast and was able to take her breakfast to the room for her to enjoy while she got ready for the day. We only had 1 night where we were not out sightseeing to enjoy the wine and appetizers. Both times were very nice to visit with other guests of the hotel. The location could not have been better. We had tickets to a show in the theatre district our first night and that was only 2 blocks away. We were also very close to great dining and shopping in the Union Square area. Having the cable stop to take you back to the hotel is a very nice bonus. We bought the 3 day Muni pass while waiting for our luggage at the airport and with that pass had unlimited use of the cable cars, the trains and the buses. It was a great, easy way to get around the City. We especially appreciated the JDV "Greeter" program. Jonathan showed us around the Haight/Ashbury area as well as Noe Valley. He also gave us a great education on using public transportation and utilizing the MUNI line for help via cell phone with any directions needed. We loved our visit to San Francisco and especially loved the White Swan Inn. I would not even consider staying anywhere else on my next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: 7373Houston
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with 5 year old twins. We had a great stay. While the room was smallish - expected for San Francisco, the staff was outstanding! Decor was lovely and location slightly noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: tgsapo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days at the White Swan Inn during a business trip this month. Though there were plenty of accomodation options in San Francisco, I was so thoroughly impressed by previous reviews of this hotel and decided to give it a go. I arrived by BART at approximately 2100 and walked the short distance to the hotel (about 10 minutes). The clerk was very helpful and welcoming upon check-in. The lobby was very warm and inviting; a fireplace crackled with a fire and a jar of cookies was tempting. I was given the keys to Room 31 and made my way to the second floor. I was so pleased to find the room was large, warm, and inviting. Romantic would be a good way to describe it, had I been there with my spouse. The bed was very large and comfortable with many various pillows to choose from. The fireplace created an inviting ambiance, and the books, wallpaper, and antique furnishings made it very comforting. The breakfasts were very European in distinction, with small pastries, frittatas, cereals, and fruit. The coffee was excellent! The evening wine and appetizers were delicious, elegantly displayed, and thoroghly satisfying. It was a pleasant experience to visit with other guests at the hotel. The hotel is located on Bush street, and is within walking distance to all things San Francisco. The only dollars spent for transportation were on the BART to and from the airport. It was 10 minutes walking distance to shopping and Chinatown and 30 minutes to Pier 39. There are numerous restaurants in the area. I was very impressed with the friendliness of the people in San Francisco. It seems to be a city centered on the arts and its people. The "liberal" reputation of the city was not completely overt to me. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again, and am hoping to return in the near future with my spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: kr_perry
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ashleigh Suite for 6 nights in November and found the experience to be more than satisfactory in every way. From the initial booking phone call to our departure we were treated exceptionally well by the staff. Our lodgings were large, clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were delicious as were the late afternoon wine and appetizer offerings.
