Other treats included all day tea, coffee and cookies, chocolates on the bed at turndown and a newspaper at our door every morning. This property is well located close to the cable car route and within easy walking distance of Union Square and a multitude of excellent restaurants. Try it. You'll like it. We did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: Patti-Art
Reviews.Content: We chose the White Swan Inn because of it's great location near Nob Hill, Union Square and the cable car line. It was a delightful place to stay. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable and the amenities and extras are a wonderful touch. Excellent breakfast, cookies in the afternoon and hors d'oeuvres and wine before going out to dinner with the added bonus of meeting and chatting with other guests. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: LucieandMarc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week-end in San Francisco at the White Swan Inn. The hotel is charming, and we thrououghly enjoyed our stay. The service was very friendly. Our room was very spacious, cute and extremely comfortable. We loved the chocolates and the champagne we found in our room when we checked in! The price was right considering all we got! The location was fabulous - just a hop away from Powell Street Cable Cars. The breakfast was good and hearthy. The wine reception gave us an opportunity to meet other travelers and become friends with a charming couple from Louisianna! We were fortunate to be taken around the city one morning by one of the Golden Gate greeters - what an experience, to be able to visit the city with a volunteer local. Lucie & Marc from Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “Be so lucky to stay at The White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: gleelamb
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn is too great a best- kept secret to keep secret! It's in the heart of the hub of San Francisco, on Bush Street, within walking distance of Union Square with lots of art galleries and shopping, yet it's like an oasis when you walk in. Warmly decorated, quiet, fireplaces going everywhere, a staff that's truly "there to serve!" A small courtyard downstairs off the library where complimentary wine (and good ones) and cheese are served every late afternoon and a large complimentary breakfast is served every morning.Terrific amenities, including pillow chocolates.... car parking is easily coordinated and taxis are there pronto when called.I've never felt that I got so much Bang for the Buck and great memories to take home and file for future trips back! --------------

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CeceNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and the Inn was our first experience with a Boutique Hotel. From check-in to check-out we were extremely impressed by the quality of service. All the staff was very helpful and friendly giving us directions, making restaurant and show reservations, suggesting sites to visit and in general making us feel at home. The building was quite charming and very comfortable. Our room was larger than it looked on the website and very clean & cozy. The breakfasts were abundant and tasty - we didn't need lunch. The wine and cheese each afternoon gave us time to wind down after a day of sightseeing while meeting other guests doing the same. By the way, the cheese, crackers, fruit and wine selections were great (also the all day cookies).When we return to SF, we will be staying at The White Swan Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay at The White Swan”
Reviews.Author: GracieBell
Reviews.Content: My sister, mother and I just returned from our trip to San Francisco where we stayed at the White Swan Inn 10/18 through 10/22. We were in California to celebrate my mom's 70th birthday. We spent 4 nights/5 days at the White Swan Inn at the beginning of our trip. The White Swan Inn was a great choice. It was a great small hotel in a big city in a good location. We had a room on the 1st floor with not much of a view other than a giant tree & a building behind us. But, it worked out fine for my mom who does not navigate stairs very well. There is an antiquated elevator that works perfectly fine for those that may be interested or need it. The hotel is older of course but very clean and tidy. Our room was spacious enough to accomodate the three of us with a king bed and a pull out sofa. At the beginning of our stay it was a bit chilly. The middle through the end of our stay the San Francisco weather was beautiful & warm. On warmer days, it did get a bit stuffy in the room in the evening and overnight. We did open the windows (our room had no screens) and this did help with the ventilation. On chilly mornings/evenings, the gas fireplace and heater in the room worked very well. The room, the bathroom, and the rest of the hotel are all very clean. As I mentioned before, a bit older but clean. The breakfast in the morning was good and of course very convenient. This made timing in the morning much easier so we didn't have to find breakfast every morning. Breakfast we certainly adequate with normally 2 hot items (quiche and scrambled eggs), hard boiled eggs, some type of protein (normally sausage), fresh fruit, bread, croissants, warm oatmeal, cold cereals, 2 juices, coffee, tea, etc. It was plenty to start off your busy day of touring San Francisco and the surrounding areas. Evening wine & cheese was also very nice with one type of red and white wine being offered along with a few hors o'dourves (normally some type of veggie & dip, brushetta on crackers, cheese & crackers, small meatballs, etc.). There were typically 3 items served each evening (at least on the evenings we made it). On my mom's 70th birthday we were in Napa all day. When we returned around 7pm there was a birthday cake in the room waiting for her - courtesy of the White Swan. I thought that was very nice. Our travel agent mentioned the birthday when making the reservation. The front desk staff at the White Swan Inn were always friendly and helpful. Kevin was exceptionally nice and very helpful. Another gentleman, Andy I believe his name may have been, who brought us to our room and also seemed to prep the area for the wine reception was also very nice. We appreciated the cleanliness and neatness of the hotel as well as the morning breakfast and evening wine and cheese. I would recommend the White Swan Inn to anyone staying in San Francisco and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. would want to know about the pull out sofa condition since it certainly seems that everything is well maintained at the White Swan. We will certainly recommend the White Swan to anyone traveling to San Francisco and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, quaint bit of England in SF”
Reviews.Author: chandito
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place numerous times and with different owners. The place has never disappointed. It is charming, romantic, cozy, etc... It has the benefit of being in a great location if you want to expore SF by foot (is there any other way?). The breakfast is yummy and the ambiance is so wonderful. The rooms are nice and the people that work there are very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: woodsjc
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in late August, and really loved our time here. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Our room faced the little courtyard, and we had no problem with noise. This might be more of an issue at the front of the building. We really appreciated all the complimentary things that come with the room - wireless internet, newspaper, water and soft drink as well as homemade cookies in the foyer, the lovely breakfast each morning, and the wine and nibbles late afternoon. The hotel is in a good position - one and a half blocks to the cable car and two block to Union Square. We found it very easy to get around from here. Staff were always pleasant and helpful. The bulding has a lovely ambience, with some interesting items on display. The lift is quite ancient, but fits the building. I'd suggest only using it when you want to move your bags up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Fun escape at the White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: bridge_traveler5
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with our stay. Very spacious room for the price in the city and the fireplace was a nice addition. We were passing through the city from up north and had a peaceful night with delightful british breakfast in the morning complete with keish and the best soda bread on the planet made by an employee at the hotel. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: DeSimoni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Swan Inn for five days. The room is outdated a little and needs to be updated, but it is very clean and neat. The staff were always friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was very good. Unfortunately, never made it to the wine and cheese in the afternoon. As for quietness, if you want quiet, do not come to San Francisco, there is always street noise in the mornings. We will definitely come back to the White Swan Inn or try one of her sister hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable and unsafe-feeling”
Reviews.Author: vatoca
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place. The breakfast and wine/cheese offerings were well done, but the rooms did not make me feel comfortable or safe. The first room they put me in had a heater that apparently never shuts off, and in May, although SF is not terribly hot then, it was extremely hot and stuffy; I got NO sleep the first night I was there. I had to ask about it 4 times, have a fan put in the room, and finally move to a different room. I also didn't feel very comfortable because the windows don't have screens on them, so to open the window (which I needed to do because it was so blasted hot!) would not have made me feel safe. Especially because there's a fire escape stairs route all across the back of the building. As a woman alone in the room, I felt very unsafe opening the windows. In short it was a lose-lose situation. The staff tried to be helpful, but unfortunately I think this was just an unfixable problem with the property that could only be helped with some major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Julz_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our honeymoon here and stayed only 2 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. At check in, we were upgraded to a luxury king room and enjoyed complimentary champagne and chocolates. The room was like a small apartment! It was fantastic! We had a fire place (and since it was chilly in San Fran during our stay - the fire place was great!) Breakfast in the morning was nice. Fresh fruits, eggs, toast, cereals. The evening wine and muchies were great as well. We enjoyed talking with other guests and it really did become a bit of a social hour(s) :) The location is perfect as well. Only a block from the Powell line cable car stop and 2 blocks to Union Square. It was a great end to a great trip! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the White Swan Inn!”
Reviews.Author: NHfamily
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of bed and breakfasts in San Francisco we chose the White Swan Inn for our nine-day visit, and were very pleased with our choice! We found the front desk staff to be extremely helpful and friendly, with everything from restaurant recommendations to phoning in our airline confirmation promptly so that we had excellent seats on our long flight back to NH. Our hotel room (#31)was spacious and beautiful, and the Belgian chocolates on the bed each night, the bedside switch that blazed the fireplace, and rosemary/verbena lotions and soaps were added touches to the delightful overall ambiance. The breakfasts were wonderful; fresh fruit, croissants, fresh hot breads, quiches, sausages, scrambled eggs, french toast, as well as hot and cold cereals, juices, coffee and teas. We looked forward to the evening wine receptions in front of the fireplace or by the garden area before going out for the evening, with wonderful appetizers along with wine and sherry, and 40's style music playing softly in the background. All through this British-themed inn are evidences of the attention to detail that has been paid to guests' comfort and enjoyment. That, in addition to the central location, made this a perfect choice for a San Francisco stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: Aussie2urist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were not happy with this hotel. There is no air-conditioning and the noise between rooms is very poor. For the amount of money we had to pay ($240.00 +) we don't consider this hotel worthy of the price being asked. The breakfast was just adequate. If you want a quiet, comfortable hotel to stay I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good value,but”
Reviews.Author: snillor
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent 2 nights at the white swan inn. the staff was gracious and helpful but the rooms seemed a little dated and musty. For the money its still a good place to stay but I think its gone down a few notches since our last visit.

Reviews.Title: “As Wonderful as those infamous cable cars”
Reviews.Author: Ogiegirl
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn offers its visitors a true escape into a world of luxury, enchantment and beauty not found too often in the travel industry. Each guest is treated like a king or dignitary. The breakfast is wonderful, the wine hour fantastic and the staff attentive to every detail to make your stay wonderful. The room is cozy and warm and soundproof. The location in Nob Hill is fantastic - only a short walk to the cable line and bus lines - and a few blocks down hill to great shopping in downtown San Francisco. This boutique hotel is every bit as memorable and romantic as those fabled cable cars. We travel more than 2000 miles to get to the White Swan - thus you know we love it. It's been our vacation destiny for the past three years! I dream of our return. Please don't ever change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: eloiseconnecticut
Reviews.Content: I was initially nervous to book a hotel on-line that no one I know had ever heard of or stayed at. What a wonderful surprise. The rooms are a nice size, the decor pleasant and the breakfast and dining area superb. I highly recommend the White Swan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: TexasYorkielover
Reviews.Content: There is no rating category high enough for this delightful boutique hotel. It was WAY beyond my expectations. There is not enough space here to do this place justice. The room was wonderful, and having a fireplace to use in June was a treat. The front desk staff was helpful every time we needed them. The wine reception each evening was a real treat, as was the gourmet continental breakfast. When you pull up to this hotel, it does not look particularly impressive from the outside. But just wait! It's worth every penny you will spend to stay here. It's very conveniently located. We never took our car out of the garage because the trolley and bus access is nearby. We will never again search for a place to stay in San Francisco. This is it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mookdogg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Inn for two nights during the month of June, during a record heatwave. Good Points about the hotel: -Wine and Appetizer selection in the evening is very enjoyable. It 's a nice way to relax after busy days of traveling and sight seeing. -Breakfast are very convient and quick. Fresh fruit is really good, otherwise standard buffet breakfast. -Hotel has complimentry beverages in the refigerator -Very large rooms, Their is a seperate closet and sink area, meaning two people can using sinks at the same time -Hotel Front desk and all staff are very nice and made great reccomendations and reservations for dinner places. You get very individualized attention, something you will not get at a larger hotel Bad points -Bathrooms are a little dated. -Very old elevator, some may feel it adds to the charm. -We stayed during a record heat wave, and very poor ventalation no AC, Ceiling fans, or window screens. The fans or screens would of really helped and probably would have been more comfortable. Most places in SF did not have proper colling facilites. More a risk of traveling during the summer No Opinion In room Fire Place Overall. Very charming hotel, I would stay there again and reccomend it to others as well. The staff is very friendly, and one of the hotel's assets.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Accomodating & Romantic White Swan!!”
Reviews.Author: chechina
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress enough how completely accomodating the White Swan is. I needed to shorten my original 5 night booking several times; I was never charged any penalties; they understood and served my every need, the comfort and peacefulness was amazing. The bedding was luxurious; the bathroom clean and fresh, wonderful shower. It helped to have free drinks chilled and ready; cookies ready for a midnight snack in the lobby; a wine tasting with dip and quiche in the afternoon plus a marvellous breakfast waiting, all at no extra charge!! Each and every question and request was met instantly with a "can do" attitude, and our comfort was of extreme concern to the staff. Decoration is charming, thoughtful and historic. An experience in itself. Apparantly they are less concerned about their profits than your comfort and convenience, and put out every effort to make sure you have everything you need w/out nickel and diming you in the process. I greatly appreciated the beautiful fireplace, the cozy lobby and stress of the upkeep of this historic property. The feel is complete San Francisco--a throwback to a more leisurely and genteel time period with every modern convenience and then some--all graciously offered with hospitality and charm. They even had a nice selection of interesting books in the rooms to help you get to sleep and pass the time. I would advise you to contact the property directly for reservations as they were fast, accomodating and absolutely hassle free. It was a cheap cabride to the Great American Music Hall and Union Square where I visited, and took in the city tour from there. It was heavenly coming back to rest here after two concerts in a row that were late--we called the White Swan and they arranged cabs immediately for us to pick us up at our destination even at 1:00 a.m. I sincerely couldn't have asked for more. The ambiance and relaxation I was afforded here made the trip much more memorable and atmospheric, and I plan to return this month to savor the City again from atop Nob Hill at the White Swan!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: tipatzschke
Reviews.Content: The White Swann Inn is a lovely small retreat in the heart of San Francisco. With Cable Car and bus in walking distance a perfect place to explore the city. The Inn has the charm of a country inn in England, though in the heart of San Francisco. A garden in the back, a charming common area downstairs, a library, complimentary wine tasting, fire places... The list is long and makes your stay exceptional. The rooms are spacious and let you feel at home right away. Last but not least, the friendly and helpful staff makes your stay something special.

Reviews.Title: “White Swan Inn Delight”
Reviews.Author: Mililani
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the beautiful and inviting White Swan Inn. The service at this hotel is excellent and since we had stayed here before we knew about the wonderful breakfast, the warm fireplace, the cookie jar and the great people at the front desk. Everyone made us feel so very welcome. The room was very clean and tidy. They have new Lather bath products which are heavenly to use. I even asked for a couple of extra bars of the soad to take home. Andy was his usual helpful self! He brought us a bottle of wine as it was my Birthday--he did this last year also. Andy is an icon at the hotel----seems he's been there for years, always giving directions, assisting with luggage, and just brightening everything up with his great smile. We will, of course, be back next year, and can't wait to hear all about the new Joie de Vivre happenings. Diane & Leroy

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Adreanna
Reviews.Content: Perfect for me.. Loved my stay. Great location and breakfast was great. Your going to love it there.

Reviews.Title: “I have been coming back to this great hotel since the '90's”
Reviews.Author: atldm
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at the White Swan, I had called to book the Petit Auberge. It had no rooms available so the staff suggested the White Swan. The two hotels are much the same but I prefer the White Swan and continue to book a room there when I am in San Francisco. The decor has changed to the "flowery" look it has now and bears are everywhere. It isn't my preference, but the large rooms, the working fireplace, the wonderful breakfast and the late afternoon sherry and wine make the inn what it is. Just great. The helpful, friendly staff are a plus as well. Because it is a small hotel, you have a chance to meet a lot of very interesting guests to share travel tips and conversation with at the afternoon "tea". .I walk everywhere and like its location for that too. ldmobley

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Central SF”
Reviews.Author: sebx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 43 for just over $200 per night. The room is spacious, clean and quiet. It even sports a gas-operated open fireplace. The hotel feels a lot like an English B&B: cosy, warm, personable and great breakfast. Definitely recommended, although you may find that a room in sister hotel Carlton for half the price does the job just as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cutesy-pie kitsch”
Reviews.Author: Mamakalisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week in April. The White Swan is very well situated for getting aorund San Francisco and has some excellent restaurants in the close vicinity. The staff were polite but impersonal, and some of the 'backstage' women were downright miserable. My room was flowered from carpet to walls and back again. The roses and teddy bears are really overdone. There was plenty of hot water and a tiny bath. The bed was comfortable and the coffee machine in the room was great. The bed was a pretty tight fit into the room, but otherwise there was plenty of space and a fireplace which was a nice touch. The 'gourmet' breakfasts were nothing of the kind. Every day the eggs were overcooked and offered with sausages and the fruit choice never varied. However, complimentary snacks were on offer every evening, with teas and coffee and drinks - a nice way of bringing all the guests together if that is what you are looking for. I loved escaping the somewhat forced jollifications on the quiet deck outside that was surrounded by pleasant greenery. I think the White Swan is good value for money and very conveniently located, but having now stayed in a genuine and authentic English country garden hotel I can honestly say the Wahite Swan comes nowhere close to it. Next time I will stay in a hotel without pretensions.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JamieMSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister, and I stayed here for 5 nights as a fun "girls" getaway, and it was exactly what we wanted. Charming, old-fashioned, homelike rooms with enough space for three women to get ready in the morning -- pretty floral and plaid decor that would perhaps appeal more to the ladies than the gentlemen -- a working gas fireplace -- excellent location that's convenient to Union Square and to cable car lines down to the bay -- good restaurants within walking distance in an area where we felt safe walking after dark -- a pleasant staff that was helpful with calling cabs, making dinner reservations, providing suggestions. We were very happy here and would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Fun change of pace.”
Reviews.Author: conprojman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swann for 3 nights around the first of February and loved it. The breakfasts were great, lots of choices, fresh fruit, quiche, croissants etc. The rooms were different and fun, our daughter loved the bears and ended up taking one home. The evening wine social was a nice time to meet others and relax. The hotel is close to cable cars, Union square etc. very easy to get around. Tip: get a MUNI 3 day pass for the buses and cable cars etc. and you save tons on transportation. $18 for three days was a great deal. You will not be disappoitnted with the White Swann Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Vickinbobyo
Reviews.Content: I thought maybe we made reservations at the wrong Inn after reading the reviews, but I verified the address and yes, we were staying at the same place Where to start, when we arrived the staff was very accommodating and helpful and this was true throughout our stay. But the Inn needs serious maintenance. Our first room's shower was filthy with mold everywhere. But we were tired and decided to ask for a different room the next morning. Big mistake, the bed had a broken spring on the left side and my husband could not sleep at all. The next morning we asked to change rooms, and they said no problem it would be about 20 minutes and we could move. We waited an hour and called back and said what if we upgrade can we get a room now. They said yes, only $20.00 to upgrade. Another hour passes, we call again, they have to go check on the room they will call back, finally after another half of an hour we call back and finally move ourselves. The Inn staff is nice but the right hand does not know what the left hand is doing. The evening wine and snacks are great. The breakfasts, edible. After all we went through I was surprised they still charged us the additional $20.00. Needless to say not a place I would stay again,

Reviews.Title: “B Islanders Loved the WS”
Reviews.Author: BeeIslander
Reviews.Content: For our 30th wedding anniversary, we chose a trip to San Francisco. After much research, we fortunately picked the White Swan for our 4 nite stay. We had been to London in 2006 and were attracted to the European boutique style hotel. It is not a hotel for everyone, particularly if you are into modern. But it you love history and antiques and the atmosphere such presents, you will fall in love with this hotel. First, the staff is very welcoming and knowledgeable about the area. They provide you with a list of outstanding local restaurants and were exceptionally helpful with tourists sites. The SF City tour they recommended was incredible. The hotel is also totally convenient to downtown SF. It is about one block to a cable car & then two blocks downhill to Union Square. It is one block uphill to the Mark Anthony Hotel and Grace Cathedral. The room we had was great. We splurged on a Deluxe King bed room. It was spacious, had windows overlooking a side greenery area, was beautifully decorated in red/green plaid bedding with floral wallpaper. The most unexpected but wonderful discovery was the hotel's original, and in perfect working condition, old type elevator with its pull back metal screen door (think the movie Charades). The food was fabulous, starting with a hot breakfast that changed daily. I loved the french breadpudding. Breakfast, included in your roomrate, had a variety of eggs, quiche, sausage, fresh fruit, toast, pastries, and hot gourmet oatmeal. The breakfast room is full of antiques. In the early evening, wine was served with a variety of cheese, crackers, fruit, fresh vegies, and a dessert. In the late evening coming in after a cold walk in the rain, we welcomed the hot cider and again fresh homemade cookies. The hotel was one of the great highlites of our trip. We highly recommend it--particularly to couples. We will of course stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the White Swan, want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Raiza123
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our one year anniversary and this was a perfect vacation. We stayed 2 nights / 3 days and it was perfect way to see San Francisco. We loved the location! It was sucha nice quiet resort in the middle of the city. We were right off the cable car line and could hop over a few blocks to Union Square & visit the beautiful Christmas tree. We walked over to China town and were able to go up the cable line to Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car museum. Basically all the good "tourist" sites. The price was very reasonable. We lucked out on the weather. The breakfast in the mornings was quite nice and we enjoyed the appetizers and wine in the evenings right before going out to eat. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Our bed was comfortable, the room was clean and we enjoyed the fireplace in the room (all rooms have fireplaces here). I could rave on & on but I think you get the idea. Blissful, romantic, good location, nice staff, good price...

Reviews.Title: “Just what I hoped for in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTraveller
Reviews.Content: The White Swan was inviting from the first moment we arrived. The staff was extremely helpful without being effusive. The room was exactly as pictured on the many web sites unlike so many other hotels. The breakfasts, wine and cheese and cookies were a definite plus and the price was not prohibitive. The fireplace was totally welcome on our last day (typical dreary San Francisco winter weather) and made the experience all the cheerier. I could do without the teddy bear, but he didn't take up that much room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas vacation!”
Reviews.Author: RBC229
Reviews.Content: Based mainly on the reviews we read here, we selected the White Swan to visit the Bay Area over Christmas. The property was charming, the breakfasts were both satisfying and varied from day to day, and the location was convenient. I expected small rooms but the rooms were more than adequate in size. The staff was extremely helpful, taking time to fill us in on not just local attractions but discussing local culture and news. It was a perfect location for a family Christmas gathering, with the fireplaces (we brought our own stockings). The walk to Union Square was easy. We stayed there with our children 15 & 23, and they liked it as well. We checked out at noon and they graciously let us store our luggage until late that evening. If I had to stretch to pick negatives, I would mention that the bathroom fan sounded like an airplane engine, but that was the only negative. Overall a very nice experience in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very kitsch and twee if that is your thing (e.g a teddy bear on the bed and a fake open fire). It is not mine but persuaded by my partner who wanted to stay somwhere different we gave it a try. It was a very comfortable stay. I think this is the word that best sums up this hotel: comfortable. The staff were very helpful. We had a very nice stay here. The only downside I would identify is that the breakfast was a bit dull and repetitive.

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to the majority of reviews, I did not enjoy it.”
Reviews.Author: smrtdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one evening in the first week of November. We stayed on the 5th floor. The room was very warm when we checked in. It had a western exposure so I could understand that. We called the desk and asked for a fan. They brought us a box fan that had filthy blades. When I turned it on I got a shower of dust and unknown particulate. The breakfast was OK, Quiche was overcooked (scrambled) and oatmeal needed some attention. The T.V. volume would not allow one to watch TV from the bed. We could not hear it. The staff, other than one of the gentlemen who worked the desk were terrific and helpful. The aforementioned desk attendant had an attitude and was snobby and unfriendly. Location is great. You can walk anywhere from here. The room was tired and reminded me of my great grandmothers old guest room. Two thin bath towels and a box of coronet tissue tossed on to the back of the toilet were the amenities in the old bathroom that had a constant drip. The showerheads are about as spartan as they can get. I say upgrade a few things boys. Overall...been there, wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay - gotta love JDV hotels in SF”
Reviews.Author: Soulmates33
Reviews.Content: I had a mid-week business trip to San Fran, so my wife came along and we extended our stay thru the weekend. The White Swan is not the most prestigious hotel in SF, but we really had a perfect stay. The Swan is part of the JDV group of hotels and they are some of the best bargains in all of San Fran. You just need to know upfront that they are meant to be a little off the beaten path. Remember, you get what you pay for. In the case of the Swan, we got... The GOOD - A BnB style hotel with an English Parlor theme, filled with antiques - A king room w/ a fireplace (room # 27 on the first floor), sitting room, walk-in closet, large bathroom with two sinks - free buffet breakfast (not cold continental bfast) - In-and-out valet parking (for a $32 fee) - Free afternoon cocktails - Friendly staff that really went out of their way to make our stay comfortable - All for the reasonable price of $229 per night Now, the NOT-SO GOOD - Old building, although renovated - Narrow hallways - Old-ish furniture - No air conditioning - Located on Bush Street, so you have to walk all the way UP the hill from Union Square, Powell or Market Streets So, overall we had an outstanding stay, but again, anyone considering the White Swan or any other JDV hotel should understand that these are boutique hotels meant for those who want to stay someplace nice without spending $400 per night. ** The bottom line, I absolutely would recommend this property to anyone and we would definitely stay there again. **

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line Service”
Reviews.Author: RoadsterGirlie
Reviews.Content: It has been 14 years since I have been to San Francisco, and my husband has never been there. I booked a 4 night stay at the White Swan Inn, and we were not disappointed. Not really knowing the city, the staff was extremely helpful with both recommendations for restaurants, and places to see and things to do. They were always pleasant, and happy to accomodate with any questions or requests. The valet was extremely convenient, considering parking yourself in the city is a pain, and I'm so glad it was available. This place is NOT your run of the mill, cookie cutter Best Western. If you are looking for something with character, charm and history, look no further. This hotel is almost 100 years old, but is extremely well-kept for its age. The room was very large (we had the luxury king), with walk-in closets and a fireplace in the room. It was extremely charming, and we had a wonderful time here. It was conveniently located within walking distance of just about anything in the city - if something's too far to walk to you, the cable cars are within two blocks of the hotel. I definately recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “great inn in the city”
Reviews.Author: sakimagog
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the inn through luxuxy link, we were not disappointed. At our arrival the wine and hors d'oeuvres were fantastic. Not just a few crackers and cheese but a salad, plenty of cheeses ,breads ,crackers , dessert and we never ran out of wine!! The staff was very helpful with city directions and so nice. The hot and cold breakfast was amazing, it got us ready for our day long adventure. The location is perfect, we walked all over and at night we were a hop away from the cable cars. The room was spacious and clean. We are highly recommending the inn to all our friends. Price quality it was our best deal on our trip...,

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: Our travel party consisted of my huband and myself on our 33rd wedding anniversary. We were first time travelers to San Francisco, and I booked the White Swan Inn based on TripAdviser reviews and forum posts by the "experts". We were not disappointed. They allowed us to store our luggage after arriving early from the airport, well before the 3:00 p.m. check-in. We got a cup of tea and set out to see San Francisco. We didn't arrive back until late afternoon, and we were very happy to have the large comfortable king-sized bed awaiting us along with our luggage. Even though the weather was gorgeous, we lit the fireplace every evening and enjoyed the cozy ambience it lent to the room. The location was fantastic...we found several small restaurants, cocktail lounges, and small Mom and Pop delis in the area. It is also very convenient to the local transportation system. When we return to San Francisco, this hotel will certainly be on our short list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful visit to the White Swan Inn!”
Reviews.Author: indyprb
Reviews.Content: We returned to the White Swan Inn for a five night stay. We have been visiting the Inn since 1995 and always come back when traveling to San Francisco. Love the breakfast and the wine reception in the evening (esp. fun if friends are also staying there). We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: bigheart353
Reviews.Content: great service. nice people. wonderful breakfasts with the best Irish Soda bread and terific chocolate chip cookies in eth evening.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, quaint, but maintanance issues that shouldn't be for $'s Paid”
Reviews.Author: ChickyWahWah
Reviews.Content: Pros. Generally a charming place with teddy bears on beds and sleeper sofa. Our room was more spacious than 4-star hotel where we stayed prior 3 nights in San Francisco. Beds were comfortable, nice little wet bar area, lots of hot water, & decent hot breakfast. Accommodating staff. Very clean. The fireplace was a very nice touch. Small grocery across street & a small sandwich shop that probably closed around 9 p.m. Downstair sitting & dining areas are very pleasant & lots of old world charm. Cons. The fifth floor room appeared to need some TLC. The faucet in the wet bar leaked & could not get it to turn off. My husband had to shut off the water, water dripped from cold water faucet in bathroom, repeatedly asked for extra towels that never arrived for we had 3 persons in room, & 19 inch color tv (cable hookup with lots of channels) with sound that was very low & barely could be heard with street noises. There probably are governors on the sound so occupants cannot turn on tv too loudly. This is not a problem unless you want to really listen to tv intensely, but who would --this is San Francisco!!! The elevator left much to be desired. It had its own charm, but if a person left the gate open, then the elevator would not operate. This was tough trying to haul baggage to main floor when leaving hotel. There is no way to let front desk know about this problem unless you go back to your room or someone ventures down the stairs. We lost 10 minutes just trying to get from fifth floor to main floor when leaving for our flight. Breakfast does not start until 7 a.m., which is ok while not on business or needing to get an early flight out. Our son was in dining room at 7 a.m. when departing, but no food was even ready -- we had no breakfast before leaving for our flight. You have to go to first floor to get ice, but this is not a deal breaker. My husband did not really feel comfortable venturing out after 9 p.m. on street so got food from small grocery across street. During day, great location & felt safe-- easy 15 minute walk to Union Square & major shopping.

Reviews.Title: “France in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LauraASanFranciso
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay while work was done in my home. I am an SF resident, so I needed a place to replicate home, I work at home. I have been staying at all the big local 4 & 5 star hotels and found their huge machine-like operations distasteful. We were paying club rate and being treated like children! In one a printed sheet informs one how to dress for their breakfast â€“ (basically a Dennyâ€™s meal), told not to take food out of the room and you are watched on cameras. We were paying a high club rate for being treated like escapees from Miss Mannerâ€™s prison. But those hotels are clean and have all the amenities we need â€“ Internet, etc. I was at first not too sure about staying at a small B&B type place. The rate was good, and the pictures looked cute, so I decided to experiment. Usually online photos are better then the truth. You cannot smell mustiness online. I arrived expecting the worst to be honest. The outside is nothing spectacular â€“ just as I found in Europe. Exteriors can be deceiving. The sweetest desk person â€“ mouth full of braces revealing the most gorgeous smile â€“ was more then accommodating. â€œYou need more body lotion â€“ weâ€™ll send it up. Movie schedule â€“ let me print it out for you.â€� There was not that rushed tone of patronizing fake care. I loved the whole hotel â€“ it is an escape into a Victorian world - it is so much like European Inns, but CLEAN, no mold or mustiness. The room we stayed in was spotless. Had a hard time finding the switch to turn on the fireplace â€“ but again, there was no blown out gasp of condescension when I called down to inquire where in the room it might be hiding. The snack â€“ uh wine and cheese, grapes, etc â€“ was sweet â€“ good way to mingle. But the breakfast was beyond what I expected. The quiche is homemade â€“ I really was ready for it to be a Costco kindâ€™ve scene â€“ something made with lard and gelatin. It was light and full of veggies. There was fruit, juice, and a huge yummy pot of oatmeal. Great homemade scones and yummies. When I asked one of the serving ladies were these warmed muffins made there, she had the very slightly affronted response that comes from someone carrying the pride of their work â€“ â€œOf course!â€� I was thrilled. The cleaning people in the halls all smiled â€“ I am not kidding. When I approached them for a few more plastic bags â€“ they offered me more water. I love how the shower gave me directions. That is one way I do not feel patronized! The hotel seems to attract a clientele you more often find in Europe â€“ friendly, explorers -folks that do not what the box corporate experience. Folks that find joy in the more intimate less anonymous setting. In our spacious room at night we felt we had traveled into another time â€“ we borrowed â€œThe Stingâ€� (they have VCRâ€™s) and allowed ourselves the rare treat of vacation in our hometown.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Girlgolfpro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at this charming property. The rooms are like an English country inn and are quite spacious. The free breakfast (including egg dishes) was quite good as was the free afternoon wine and cheese offering. It was also nice to have a fridge in the room. Their location is close to public transportation to all of SF. I have stayed at many 5 star properties, but for the money, I think this was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamnotanoun
Reviews.Content: My mother and I enjoyed our 2 night stay at the White Swan. I'd give it a good, not great. The rooms are larger than I am accustomed to seeing in San Francisco which was nice. The hotel is about 4 blocks from Union Square, however the walk requires a steep uphill return of several blocks, beyond the ability of my 78 year old mother. The elevator is old, and quaint or annoying depending on your attitude. While were there almost all of the people we saw at the wine happy hour and breakfast were AARP'ers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orlsurfer
Reviews.Content: My father was stationed at Presidio back in the 80's & I fell in love w/ San Francisco. My wife & I have returned many times over the 15 yrs we've been together. We were in Sonoma April 2007 for a sales conference & spent our last 2 days in the city before we left. Our friends we were travelling with had chosen this hotel & we absolutely loved it! It was definitely an older bldg in SF but that's what gives it character. I've read several of the reviews here & must agree w/ almost all of them. I do however, take exception w/ some of the reviews w/ regard to a/c, street level noise & small rooms .... People, this is a city botique hotel. Have you ever lived in the city -- people are up at all hours! Expect street noise -- try living in it & soon you'll realize its the same. We've stayed at other hotels in SF & found the same thing -- again, its called city living. A/C in San Francisco -- its just not necessary! Open the windows & let some fresh air in. Last Sept '06 we stayed in the Van Ness / Geary Blvd area & experienced the same street noise so don't think it's just this hotel. Plus, in Sept it was gorgeous for the first few days as we hit the indian summer perfect then Saturday rolled around .... we were in a nice local pub w/ shorts on & when we left a few hours later the temp had dropped 20 degrees to below 60 w/ fog & all! I felt like I was living there again for a just a magical moment in time. Oh yeah, if you get the chance, travel a few blocks southwest & dine at Fluer De Lys -- 777 Sutter St. Chef Keller is magnifique!! If you get the chance, stay at this hotel -- but expect a city botique hotel built in the early 1900's!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: antgeeja
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel! Staff is very friendly and helpful. We booked the deluxe king room and found it very clean and spacious. The fireplace in the room was a nice treat. The hotel was built in the early 1900's and retains the original charm and character of an older building. The buffet breakfast was wonderful: quiches, fresh fruits, pastries, cereal and sausages. So much more than we had expected. Our room faced the street, and yes there is street noise. But, no much more than one would expect in any large city. True, there is no air conditioning, in fact very few hotels in the city do have a/c. But with the mild climate of San Francisco, it is almost never needed. Parking is off site, so there is a bit of a wait for your car to be brought around if you need it immediately. But, with a little planning ahead, its a non-issue. We decided to do some shopping the day of our departure and the hotel stored our luggage for us until we returned. We called ahead for our car and it was waiting for us when we returned. The hotel is within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping and the cable car lines. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable!”
Reviews.Author: NICURN05
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quaint, staff friendly, complimentary breakfast delicious. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice--BUT (!!) Quality Control and Attention to Detail Needed.”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter_7
Reviews.Content: The White Swan Inn is a very nice property located in a very convenient location--BUT(!!)--they need to do some self-inspection and quality control before they lose all of the stars and diamonds which, I assume, they've worked to earn over a long period of time. My wife and I stayed at the White Swan during a recent conference I was required to attend. We stayed 2 nights. The front desk staff welcomed us nicely although beware--there really are no bellmen to speak of. The only person on duty is the person sitting at the front desk and as such, you will be required to carry your luggage up the front stairs and into the lobby. Very nice guys at the front desk and they probably would have assisted with the luggage if asked...but should one have to ask at a place with a lot of diamonds and stars? Because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor and in publications that award diamonds and stars, we decided to stay in the property's only suite accomodation: The Ashleigh Suite. It was nice but, again, beware--there are certain things you should know. The living room part of the suite faces the front of the hotel, directly on Bush Street...and at ground level. It's a tad bit noisy but not too bad--if you don't mind some street noise. The hotel is not air-conditioned which would not necessarily be a bad thing given that San Francisco is usually pretty cool, temperature-wise and you can open the windows. HOWEVER--in the living room portion of the Ashleigh Suite, the windows do not open. They have been closed in with plexi-glass presumably to thwart people from breaking in. In theory, that's a great idea--but in practice, there is no way to cool down the room with outside air because the windows don't open. In the bedroom portion of the Ashleigh Suite, the windows do open but, beware--there are things one should know. The bedroom portion faces what is, in essence, a small courtyard. It's a narrow courtyard and each room (from the ground level where the Ashleigh Suite is) to the top floor faces one another. That's not really unexpected because it's a small, older building. BUT--the narrow courtyard has become a disgusting pigeon sanctuary filled with pigeon poop; fighting birds, white feathers on the window sills and constant cooing. Why can't they get someone out there once a month or so and just wash it down with a garden hose? Why can't they do something to keep the birds out of there? If you don't need to open the windows, then this is a non-issue. But if you want fresh air in the room (remember, there is no A/C), expect everything connected with pigeons. Oh--and by the way--the cooks who come in at 5:30 to get the complimentary breakfast prepared can be heard from the Ashleigh Suite...if you decide to leave the windows open. It is almost as if they were in your room. I can only guess that the kitchen must be right under the Suite. I'm sure they would have lowered their voices if we had called the front desk, but should one have to call the front desk for something like this at a place with a lot of diamonds and stars? The decor in the Ashleigh Suite is nice but beware--it's getting tired and worn and sooner, rather than later, the owners are going to perform an overhaul. Two of the lamps were broken and fell apart when turned on. The bedspread was, when it was newer, nice--but now it's getting old. The bathrooms (there are two in the Ashleigh Suite because it's basically two connecting rooms) are very clean but still, feeling their age. How about some new tile on the floors? Don't get me wrong. The place is nice. The location is outstanding. The valet parking works fine. (It costs $34 per night and you have to wait 30 minutes between calling for the car and getting it--but that's manageable). The breakfasts are plentiful with fresh fruit, pastries, quiche, sausage and toast. Pretty much the same things everyday--but still, above average...and included in the rate. The room refrigerators are stocked with complimentary waters and soft drinks. How many places do you know that do that? The afternoon wine and cheese is a very nice touch although, on one night, they served a green salad, of all things. There were other things like green olives but the salad was odd...and not very practical. Still, though, it's complimentary. There is a small patio off of the main dining area--BUT--it was locked and not very inviting. The bottom line: Good place, nice location, friendly people BUT--the owners better start thinking about quality control and attention to details. "Quality control" and "attention to details" are, after all is said and done, factors which help decide just how many diamonds and stars there will be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllyK4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swan in June 2007 and thought it was a very nice boutique style hotel. We were warmly greeted and the entire staff were most accomodating. We can be quite fussy about beds, but the king bed was very comfortable with good linens and pillows . The amenities were also very good - gas fireplace, old fashioned but decent bathroom, mini fridge, and a generous breakfast served downstairs. The White Swan is convenient for seeing San Francisco and given the quality is very fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kayokayo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the White Swan Inn for our anniversary. I have stayed at la Petite Auberge (hotel next door owned by the same company), but it was booked up. The front desk suggested I try the White Swan and they did indeed have a room! We only stayed one night, but I do hope that we can return soon. We got into San Francisco late and got lost, but the great folks at the front desk guided us right to the hotel with no trouble. Our room was spacious and very cozy. We had bathrobes to use and a fireplace (there is one in every room I believe). We got the valet parking added to the price of the room, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this service. They took care of the car for me and as anyone knows, parking in SF is horrible! Not to have to worry about our car was great. We let them know we needed it extra early in the morning and it was waiting for us when we needed it. The breakfast was great. Homemade breads, quiche, sausage, oatmeal, cereals, fresh fruit, coffee and tea were provided (more, I'm sure, but we couldn't try it ALL). The White Swan is very close to a lot of places of interest in SF. It's a hop from Chinatown and very close to Union Square. It really is conveniently located for so many things. While I am a seasoned visitor to San Francisco, I did hear the staff giving great advice to visitors and recommending some wonderful places to visit. I asked the concierge about the history of the hotel and he was extremely knowledgeable. I would recommend the White Swan Inn to anyone. It's cozy, comfortable and we had a relaxing evening in our room.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: dianmarie514
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late July of 2007 and were most favorably impressed with our entire experience. The White Swan Inn was chosen based on other reviews posted on Trip Advisor. The gracious folks at the front desk were very helpful whenever we had a question. And our room! It was beautiful -- spacious and tastefully decorated. We loved the gas fireplace and turned it on each evening. Be advised that even in the middle of summer, San Francisco has chilly nights! The breakfast buffet was varied and we found it filling. Fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, an egg flan, bacon, sausage or ham, juice, coffee and tea were available each morning. The afternoon wine reception was another perk. On Friday evening, there was live music -- a delightful guitar and flute duo. We also like the fresh cookies and around the clock availability of coffee and tea. The location is up the hill from Union Square. We had no trouble walking to the Square, Moscone (Convention) Center or to the Curran Theatre to see Jersey Boys. The walk UP the hill was a bit challenging and I wouldn't recommend trying to negotiate it with luggage in tow. However, going DOWN the hill with luggage was no problem and we walked for several blocks on a Sunday morning to get to the Powell St. BART station for a $6.35 trip to Oakland Airport. On the way in, we took BART to Powell St. and then hopped in a taxi to the White Swan Inn. (An additional $10 that included a tip for the driver.) This hotel is part of the Joie de Vivre chain of California hotels. Before booking the White Swan Inn, I'd suggest joining the free Joie de Vivre Club, which gets you points towards free amenities as well as a choice of gifts upon arrival in any of their hotels. Just do a web search for Joie de Vivre hotels and you can quickly join the Club online. When asked for my preference, I opted for a bottle of red wine and it was waiting for us when we opened the door to our room. I'd go back to the White Swan Inn in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “European charm in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Chicago5
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the White Swan so we knew what to expect. This time we booked a top floor king room. The room was huge by city standards, with a separate dressing area and extra sink area, large walk-in closet, and bar area with additional sink . The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. In addition to complementary soft drinks and water, the refrig. had plenty of room to store anything else one might want to keep chilled. We found the overall service to be very good, the maids did a good job of keeping the room clean and the front desk called cabs and provided directions to where ever we were going. There was no valet to help with bags when we were there, but for us, that was not an issue. The breakfast is definitely not gourmet, but was more than adequate and plentiful. We liked the fact that there was always coffee and tea available and a nice wine hour. No, the hotel is not spanking new, but then it does not claim to be. In fact, that's part of the charm. It reminded us of a higher end, older European hotel.The bathrooms are not huge, but clean and the extra sink in the dressing area makes up for the smallish bathroom. There is no air conditioning, but then it's not really needed. The windows are easy to open and provide a nice breeze, just be sure to shut them before you go to sleep as there is a bar behind the hotel that gets noisy at closing. Overall, we had a very nice experience thanks to a good staff and pleasant, even romantic surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with some fun extras!”
Reviews.Author: daniellepal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in the beginning of May & was actually hot that weekend! He needed to be there for a conference at the Moscone convention center. He did walk there a few times but since it was hot he took 7-dollar cab rides to from the conference most days. The streets are confusing and the hill on the way back to the hotel from the main city area is super steep and did cause some thigh and calf burning! Anyways, we took a cab about $40 from the airport and we got checked in promptly. Our room was pretty big, bigger than I expected! Best part was the free mini-fridge in our room with 2 cokes, sprites, diet cokes, and bottles of water-replaced daily. The bed was a queen, the bathroom was nice, white fluffy accents and the Aveda products were a really nice touch. The hotel is decorated old English style with teddy bears everywhere. Not my style but it was fine. The free cookies were a nice touch. We went to the free wine and appetizer hour a couple of times, nice! Breakfast was good. Quiche, cereal, breads, and fruits were offered daily. Plus juice coffee and tea were offered. Better than a Holiday Inn continental breakfast, that is for sure! The hotel is like 7-8 blocks from the major shopping areas and convention center. Walking down the hill is no big deal in fact I recommend it. I went to the beach one day. I took the BART with a friend who lives there. I recommend that! The Fisherman's W. is totally touristy and new with chain and non-chain restaurants. We got crab at a cute fish market... oh and we went to Alcatraz as well. Nice tour. Buy your tickets online & in advance. When we showed up there was a sign and they were sold out for the following 3 days! Overall, good trip. Decent hotel with fun little extras at a good price. I can't remember exactly but I think we paid around $175 a night with a AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Charmer”
Reviews.Author: BridgetUrsula
Reviews.Content: The description of this darling hotel by the hotel is entirely accurate. It is a cozy, comfortable place to stay. Our room was generously sized but felt more like a bedroom in a home than a cookie-cutter hotel room. The bathroom was more than adequate, and the dressing room was a luxury. Breakfast was excellent. Easy location. Affordable valet parking was a great benefit. Everything that the hotel promised was truth. In this way, White Swan met all expecations. What made it exceed expectations was the caliber of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find in SanFrancisco”
Reviews.Author: BostonBeantown
Reviews.Content: We just loved our stay at the White Swan Inn. We enjoyed our room with plenty of space and comfortable furniture--and a working fireplace. It was very homey. The bed was very comfortable. Wine and cheese hour gave us an opportunity to mingle with the other guests and was most pleaant. The breakfast each day were reallyexcellent--a hot dish, fruit, pastries, cereal and muffins. Excellent. The room was very clean. My only small complaint was the bathroom--spolessly clean, but could use a little updating. However considering that this building was quite old, they have done a wonderful rehab job. If you stay here I think you will be pleasantly surprised both by the hotel and the very friendly and helpful stafff. Barbara Fuery

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JanesLondon
Reviews.Content: We had mentioned in passing to our travel agent that our trip to San Francisco was to celebrate my partner's birthday but were still surprised (and delighted) to find birthday balloons, a half bottle of sparkling wine and a rather sweet Teddy bear waiting to greet us! This is a great place to stay: very central, with helpful and friendly staff, comfortable beds and a good breakfast. The wine and cheese reception gives you the opportunity to meet other guests and we met some really nice people - but if you want to be private you can do that too as there plenty of places to sit and read quietly. If you're new to San Francisco then the restaurant recomendations are very helpful - and there are some great places within walking distance. You can't really go wrong here if you want the experience of staying in a small, welcoming and above all, affordable, Inn right in the centre of this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing and Accomodating-Nice Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: HarryBrentwood
Reviews.Content: Although we only stayed one night, it was obvious that this is a great close and convenient hide-away place for those interested in staying close to most of the major downtown S. F. sites and points of interest. Our room was clean, spacious, and very well appointed-no upsetting surprizes or disappointments. You can't beat the fireplace for unwinding. Well maintained for such an older building yet the age adds to the character of the place. Staff was very gracious and welcoming. Price was right too. Definitely hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Review!”
Reviews.Author: SanJosecivilian
Reviews.Content: I prefer the Boutique Hotel experience compared to namebrand, or chain hotels and The White Swan Inn is a perfect example of the reasons why. Great location in San Francisco just a few blocks from Union Square and the F line cable car. The staff were superb and attentive from the moment I arrived. I missed the complimentary social hour but upon check in a hotel employee offered me a glass of wine to have in my room, so I did by the nice fireplace. The rooms are comfortable and cozy I could have relaxed there all evening but wanted to enjoy the city's offerings. I can't say enough of the quality of the staff. Everyone there was friendly, accomodating and willing to go the "extra mile" kudos to the White Swan Inn your a success.

Reviews.Title: “A little oasis”
Reviews.Author: exgrap
Reviews.Content: A wonderful oasis in the heart of the Union Square district. Once you enter the front door you would never know that you are in a major city. Quiet and spacious rooms, friendly staff and fabulous breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: kappy9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend in May. I went out on a limb and booked a hotel out of our comfort zone (chain hotels). After reading the reviews I was confident our stay would be enjoyable. It was even better than I expected. The front desk staff did a super job recommeding restaurants to eat in. Plus the hotel has a book full of menus. The rooms were very comfortable. What we liked best was having the stocked fridge of free soft drinks and water everyday. It was great to be able take a couple of waters with us for the days adventures. The breakfast was super, it was neat to see the staff come up with a new dish everyday. What I thought was cool was that the dish was homemade and not just fom the freezer. On Cinco de Mayo we had a mexican style quiche. In the lobby they had a different cookie everyday in the cookie jar, and those could have easily just been frozen chocolate chop cookies. But each day we had a different kind of cookie (Russian tea balls, Lemon poppyseed, a shortbread of sorts, and a oatmeal chip). The location was great, except for the one hill on Powell street we had to walk up to reach the hotel from the BART. We only had one complaint, and usually we love this, but the water pressure in the shower was so strong it actually hurt. But I loved it, and would recommed this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy a "different" hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: KDORLANDO
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at White Swan Inn. The location is convenient to Union Square, Chinatown and the cable cars. Our room was lovely, clean and quiet. We enjoyed the breakfast, especially the french toast we had one morning. The staff were pleasant and very helpful, though somewhat busy at times. We would definitely stay here again. There is so much more atmosphere in a small hotel like this rather than a large chain.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Old Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4cees
Reviews.Content: I think all the positives, and negatives, described here are true. It is a quaint, maybe quirky old hotel in a decent location. Nicely decorated and excellent personal service. The breakfast was good, although the "hot" items were lukewarm. The bed was comfortable. Yes, the fixtures are old, wood/tile floors are old, there's some rust in the bathroom. If this bugs you, don't book here. My biggest complaint was the street noise in the second floor room. About every hour, we awoke to a new sound: car horn, loud talking on the street, arguing, garbage truck, tires skidding, etc. I wrote the hotel and recommended that they get dual paned windows. The hotel replied that I should have asked for a higher floor. So, if this is the kind of place for you, either wear excellent earplugs at night or get as high of a floor as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic inn”
Reviews.Author: hola_y_saludos
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly, romantic little getaway inn, and convenient to Union Square. We found the accommodations charming and comfortable, with a nice fireplace, and lovely breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: texascrowe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the heart of Nob Hill. Warm and inviting. Most of the people I met at breakfast and the afternoon Wine and Cheese Hour were returning guests. The staff was very helpful. It was so muich more pleasant than staying in an impersonal chain hotel. I felt safer knowing someone knew when I left and when I expected to return. They made my trip to San Francisco for a friends wedding seem very special.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: gmhx
Reviews.Content: What a nice little place. Large, comfortable room, pleasant common areas. Fireplaces galore. An actual reading room (books, fireplace - you get the picture). Could stand some updating but not to the point where it's an issue. Not for those seeking modern chic or luxury, but if you want a pleasant retreat in the city at a reasonable price (for San Francisco) you should consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: tragiclaura
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to decide where to stay in San Francisco, and I was happy with our choice of the White Swan Inn. It was small, quiet, romantic, beautifully decorated, and the breakfasts were great. The staff was helpful, and the location was ideally situated between Nob Hill and Union Square. The negatives: it was very cold, and there was no heat in the room. We had to get a space heater from the front desk. The bathroom door wouldn't close (the usual quirks of an old building). My biggest gripe was how cold the room was and how it had no central air or heat. I would stay here again. There were no screaming kids like you get at the hotels near Fisherman's Wharf, and the noise was not bad being several blocks from Union Square. Definitely romantic for couples for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: c1wino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while I had a conference at the St. Francis. The hotel does have a quaintness about it and the area for breakfast and wine and cheese hour was cute. The elevators did not always work. Our room was a good size but the bathroom did have mold around the tile in the tub. There was a good sized dressing room however. The fireplace was great and the room had a nice romantic feel. Mattress was a little too firm and my husband noted a faint mothball smell (I did not). Short walk to Union Sqare although a steep one. A nice touch was complimentay soft drinks, water, and a split of champagne in our room. I thought it was a good value but we will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shlepp86
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, the staff has a great knowledge of the area. Rooms are wonderful and cozy. The breakfeast and afternoon wine and appitizers are very good. Very close to cable car stop. I highley recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “traveler beware”
Reviews.Author: winnerm
Reviews.Content: Cute place - convenient location. We were really looking forward to some quite time. This hope was quickly eliminated in the very early hours of our first morning at the White Swan. We awoke to what we thought was construction going on in the room above us. We asked at the desk and they told us that there was a family with two children staying there. We told them of the noise and they said they would take care of it. The children and the noise continued throughout our stay. I have nothing against kids - have a few of my own. But when they start jumping around at 6am it is somewhat bothersom....especially when we're paying top $$ for the pleasure and our complaints were totally ignored by the front desk. Next time we'll stay somewhere else. M Winner - Honolulu, HI

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan was great!”
Reviews.Author: ilikesocks
Reviews.Content: After seeing the generally positive reviews on this site, my wife and I decided to stay here for a part of our honeymoon and we were very pleased. We wanted to stay in a cute, unique boutique kind of hotel and not a big hotel chain and that is exactly what we got. I'll try to break down this review to make it helpful. 1. Room & Decor: We stayed in a Luxury King Room on the top floor after finding a great deal on it. If you like that old world, european kind of charm then these rooms are definitely for you. We liked the antique style furniture, wood floors by the entry, the little nook with the fridge, the separate vanity area and walk-in closet, fireplace, down comforter, soft linens, etc. It was plenty big. Like I mentioned, the decor is for those that like that old european feel, not for those looking to stay in a room from a hotel chain; it's not like a hilton, marriott, etc. It's definitely not modern. --Being a smaller boutique hotel, it does not tower over it's neighboring buildings; therefore, it does not offer much of a view. On the top floor we were able to see the tops of several tall buldings but that is it. 2. Cleanliness: We were generally pleased with this. Yes, it is an older place so the bathrooms are not sparkling new; it has an older tub, toilet, etc. Even the carpets and such are older but they were vaccumed regularly. But it was definitely clean and hygenic. My wife and I didn't mind this at all because we were expecting it to be older, but we never had any problems with the cleanliness of it. I didn't give the place a white glove test but nothing stood out in our time there. 3. Service: We had great service our entire trip. Turn down service was offered every night, linens and towels were changed promptly when requested, etc. Even when we refused turn-down service they still offered us chocolates. --On our first night the bellboy (I think that's what he was) noticed we did not have a VCR in the room and immediately went and got one. --The front desk probably got tired of all the questions about restaurants and directions that we asked but they were very polite and answered each one. We were given some great suggestions on places to eat (Cafe Claude, Mama's, Kate's Kitchen, etc.) and contrary to some other experiences on here, they called a cab for us right away when we needed it on our last day. I guess it depends on who is there. --When I booked the room I asked the front desk if they do anything for honeymooners and was told they would try and do something. I wasn't expecting anything but they were so gracious and had champagne, chocolates, and a teddy bear waiting there. 4. No A/C: When booking the hotel room I called a bunch of boutique and non-boutique hotels and asked a few questions. I was surprised to find out that most of the boutique styled hotels don't have A/C. I was a bit nervous about this but it was not a problem at all (we were there at the beginning of July). With the windows open we were actually cold at night. Maybe it was because we were on the top floor but the breeze was nice and steady and at times, actually too cold. I googled the climate in SF and I found that Aug and Sept are hotter than Jun/Jul, so I guess we went at a good time, especially with the heat wave that just passed through. 5. Location: Up towards nob hill, it is about a 10 min walk to Union Square (shopping, public transportation to almost anywhere in SF), a 5 min walk to Powell St (to catch the cable car, if you'll be taking this or other public transport a lot I suggest getting a pass, otherwise it's like $5 a ride, it was totally worth it for us), 10 min to China town. Since it is up nob hill, walking anywhere means going up/down hills. We didn't mind it but if you hate walking up/down hills this might not be for you. --Being away from union square I never had a problem with beggars or people I thought might mug me. We saw a few crazier looking people every now and then, but they never bothered us and from everything I've heard, the trouble is more down in tenderloin and some other districts on the other side of Union square. I actually saw quite a few college aged kids walking around the area. 6. Breakfast: We really enjoyed the breakfast here, although I have had better breakfasts at other hotels. They offered a variety of sliced fruits (melons, etc.) and some standard fruits (apples, bananas, etc.). They always had hot oatmeal. They also had quiche. I had it hot and recently brought out all but one time, so I guess I had good timing. I can see why some people would have complained about the cold quiche. I at the last slice once and I think it had been sitting there for a while. It wasn't the best but it still tasted all right. They also offer a variety of cold cereal, orange juice, coffee, etc. They usually have some sort of breakfast meat as well, usually sausage or sausage patty. Once again, these items were great when hot, but sometimes they were sitting out for a while. 7. The Cookie Jar: When you first come in and go up the small flight of stairs to the front desk, there is a cookie jar on an armoir at the top of the stairs. They usually stock that with great cookies/other baked goods and everynight when we came back there was some sort of dessert sitting by that jar, like bundt cake, lemon bars, etc. Needless to say we loved getting that little treat each time we came back. 8. The elevator: Yes, this elevator is an old elevator; one of those where you have to close an outer sliding door and inner gate in order for it to work. This goes back to the old world, european thing. We loved it and thought it was the cutest thing (it is decorated well and we never had a problem with it not working; just remember to close both doors after you exit). However, if you're looking for something more modern this might not be the place for you. Ok that was the longest review of all time. Overall we had a great experience there; we liked our room, had great service, and would definitely go back, especially if I got such a great deal again. But like I've said, it's for those who want that old, antique kind of experience. For those that want more modern, there are some other great hotels in SF that I'm sure you'll love.

Reviews.Title: “great inn within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: luvmyyellowlab
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the White swan Inn 2 nights the first week of August. The Inn is very cozy. The parking is right out front for valet and we got the parking package so it was at a discounted rate. They do ask for a 30 minute window to bring the car around. So no problems just plan ahead. The inn could use a bell hop but we only had one bag so its wasn't a huge deal to us. We had a 5th floor room. No view but still a great room. The decor was very floral and there is no AC but it really isn't needed. A ceiling fan would be a nice touch. The room even came complete with its own teddy bear available for purchase as a momento. The mornign breakfast was very good-usually a quice as well as cereal and toast. The evening wine reception is a nice touch complete with cheese and crackers. The study area where breakfast and the wine reception are is very dark but it is very quiet and has nice decor. I would recommend this inn to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our honeymoon and a great place to stay. Centrally located in Union Sq we were able to see all of San Francisco from here. We walked to Chinatown, Northbeach and the Waterfront/ The service from housekeeping and the bell boy were awesome but the front desk was a bit pissy (wouldn't call us a cab!!!) but we had fabulous service otherwise. The breakfast was always yummy and the spread of fresh fruit for those of us watching out weight was appreciated. I would stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Not our cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: uncsig
Reviews.Content: Maybe we should have known this, maybe not. But this property has no air conditioning. Which is probably not a problem on about 300 days of the year. But when the City has a warm spell as it did on our visit, the lack of A/C renders the guest rooms and public rooms uncomfortably warm. The staff seemed stretched thin on our visit. At the afternoon reception, the cheese wasn't put out till halfway through. The white wine was no match for the warmth in the common area. At breakfast the next morning, the quiches were not even remotely warm, much less hot. And since one was not replaced when empty, there was barely enough in the second one for the four of us to get more than a couple of bites anyway. We had long been intrigued by this property. Maybe we just hit it on a bad day.
