Reviews.Title: “1st time in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days 5 nights at the White Swan Inn. I chose it because it was a B&B and also because it had a fireplace in the room. Didn't have much of a view but that was alright with us. Room was a decent size. Bed was very comfortable. Had no problems sleeping. My only complaint would be the tub. Let's just say it wasn't "SQUEAKY" clean. Size of bathroom was fine though. The breakfast every morning was very good and convenient, especially the day we rented a car and drove to Muir woods and Napa Valley. We were able to have breakfast as early as 7am and then walk a block to pick up our rental car. Also liked the evening wine service. Was able to meet other hotel guests and talk about where to go and what to see. Really liked the location of the hotel. Easy walking distance to China Town, car rental, cable car and Niketown/shopping. Had no problems with the lift. Hotel staff was nice and friendly and very helpful suggesting restaurants and sightseeing locales. All in all, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but not top choice”
Reviews.Author: jawms
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at both White Swan and Petite Auberge, a sister property, in the past, but not for several years. We were quite disappointed in our recent stay, especially compared to our last stay, when it was still a "4 Sisters Inn." The staff varied from indifferent to excellent. Our room was attractive but very dusty and our bathroom was especially so (corners, towel bars, etc.). We only had turndown service one of our 3 nights there. It was very noisy and our bed sagged in the middle. The morning breakfast was good, but not "like it used to be." Next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ricew0
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. I was in town for a convention and it is an easy walk to Moscone. It is also convenient to buses and the cable cars. The breakfast was awesome every day we were there: fresh fruit, oatmeal, banana bread or muffins from scratch, and an egg dish. And we loved the happy hour in the PM with wine and snacks. Would definitely stay here the next time in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, quirky but definately not English!”
Reviews.Author: choosyhampshire
Reviews.Content: We chose the White Swan because we wanted to avoid just another bland american hotel, and we certainly got something different! The room was large and comfortable, although the bathroom was small with dated fittings. The corridors and reception were decorated in a style that charactured "Olde England", and not "..a tribute to the luxury hotels of England." More like a provincial hotel in France. The lounge and salon areas were comfortable and a great place to meet other guests especially over the wine and cheese at 5pm, and at the sumptuous breakfast. This enabled us to get some good recommendations. The staff were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: aetChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were just recently on our first vacation together in N. California. While we were in San Francisco we stayed at the White Swan. I really wish our other hotels on the trip could have matched the service and quality of the White Swan. Our Bell Boy (Andy?) was excellent and was very enthusiastic about giving us recommendations. It is also in a great location; the hotel was very close to the cable car and union square. We would definitely recommend this place to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A very wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been patronizing the White Swan Inn for a couple of years and all of our stays at the Inn have been pleasant. In time, however, certain features will need to be updated; in particular, the bathrooms. We were fortunate to have the extra dressing area which helped tremendously. We do enjoy the quaintness of the Inn. I like the convenience of the shopping areas to be within walking distance. The complimentary breakfast and wine/cheese amenities are a wonderful feature--THANK YOU! We look forward to another pleasant stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Only way to know San Fran”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the White Swan Inn in San Francisco on our 2 anniversary. We loved the City, but most of all we loved exploring with our guide, Rick Evans, who was provided by the Inn. It was such a treat. We were so lucky to have had the opportunity to be introduced to San Francisco by such a caring and enthusistic person. We hope that when we return we will have the chance to meet with Rick again. Gil Dallas, Tx

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B & B”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 56, on the fifth (top) floor, which looks out on the back of buildings. I'm not complaining about this -- it made for a very quiet room, and the ambiance was reasonably sunny, not like a mine shaft. The spacious room is decorated with English flower prints and plaid; the gas-fired fireplace was easy to use; housekeeping spotless; coffee-maker and fridge make for easy do-it-yourself snacking; Aveda toiletries. The antique elevator seems sound. Short walk to Union Square, and the neighborhood is decently safe (it is a city!.) The staff were very helpful with directions, and anything we requested. The complimentary breakfast is excellent with a minor flaw (which I hope they will fix, at my suggestion.) The cooks are very good, with a assortment of nice baked goods, fruits, breads and cereals. The hot dishes would have been excellent if the serving pieces kept them hot. Again, the cooks know what they are doing with the baked eggs dishes, meat, and potatoes that were served avery morning, but the hotel needs to invest in better electric or chafing serving pieces to do them justice. Nice complimentary wine and hors d'ouevres at cocktail time. The lounge areas are very comfortable, nicely decorated, and people can spread out. In nicer weather, a few tables are in a walled-garden area that would be pleasant. While I have stayed in San Francisco many times before, and have enjoyed other properties, I'd easily stay here again, depending on my locational needs and plans. A small sunlit room has a treadmill, recombinant bike, and a TV, if walking around isn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleFriends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the White Swan Inn for one week of vacation and sightseeing. We enjoyed our stay thoroughly. The staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful. The room (a deluxe king) was roomy and comfortable with a charming and romantic fireplace with gas logs. Breakfasts were plentiful with hot and cold dishes. These morning treats were substantial enough to last a good part of the day. The evening wine and cheese presentations were delightful, as were our conversations with the other guests. The quirky cage elevator was at times charming â€“ and at other times maddening when a guest forgot to close the gate-like door, thus making the elevator inoperable. We would recommend this hotel without any hesitation. It is situated perfectly for Union Square, Chinatown, and public transportation. If you are unfamiliar with San Francisco, be sure to ask the front desk for the hotelâ€™s list of 20 â€œGuide Sheets.â€� These are quite helpful in getting oriented to the area.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a three-night stay at the White Swan Inn, and we both just loved it! The rooms were spacious, and the fireplace in the room was such a lovely extra. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and I thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon wine hour. If you're a walker, there couldn't be a better location. It's half-way between Nob Hill and Union Square, with China Town an easy walk, and public transportation close by. The sink in my bathroom had just a very little counter space - I could barely fit my toiletries, and if there had been a second person he or she would have been in big trouble. But my sister's room, right next door, had a lot more counter space, so the bathrooms are not all the same. I will definitely stay there again, and would recommend it to friends. The decor is definitely Victorian - think a lot of wallpaper with floral/stripe/etc. prints, so if you're looking for a soothing zen room, this isn't for you. But my sister and I sure did like it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved White Swan”
Reviews.Author: Finnish56601
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed wonderful hospitality in this charming B&B in downtown San Francisco. Their wine and cheese reception and the full cooked breakfast buffet topped off a most comfortable night's stay in our queen suite with fireplace. We would highly recommend this B&B for its overall quality, ease of transit, walking distance to shopping and restaurants plus affordability.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place with great service and a pleasing, homey feel. The fireplace was romantic, the room huge and the bathrooms the cleanest we've ever seen. People went out of their way to do things for us. Free cookies, free pop, free breakfast and a free wine and cheese reception. The chocolates on the pillows just added to the charm. We've stayed at the Pan Pacific and the Palace in SF and the White Swan beats them hands down for atmosphere and service. Dave and Helen will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms and an excellent breakfast. Small bathrooms. If you know your way around SF, itâ€™s not a bad place to stay. If youâ€™re looking for assistance and service from the front desk, stay somewhere else. I did not get the friendly helpful service youâ€™d normally get at a B&B. Maybe they were having a bad week, but I found Nevin to be very arrogant and extremely rude. The day shift wasnâ€™t much help either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B&B”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from San Francisco and we stayed @ the White Swan Inn from Monday through Friday. We had a wonderful stay. The Inn was very homey and comfortable. Nevin (works at the front desk in the evening) was fantastic as was the whole staff. The breakfast each morning was excellent and the wine & cheese hour in the evening was very nice. It gave us a chance to meet other guests and mingle. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the complimentary bottle of champagne and box of chocolates that were provided in the evening. Would definitely stay again and encourage other to do the same. Thank's to all at the Inn who helped make our vacation very enjoyable. Jill & Joy from Tampa Florida

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a long weekend in San Francisco and after searching the internet for city hotels, we chose the White Swan because of its location and the amenities noted in the advertisements. In Fact we stayed two additional days. We were not disappointed. A little gem of a place in the heart of the city. Great location, quiet neighborhood street, safe. Wonderfully attentive staff , friendly and yet professional. Took care of all requests and even provided a surprise birthday gift of wine delivered to our room (with chocolates and balloons). Our room was sunny, nicely sized, with very comfortable furnishings, arm chairs by the fireplace and a loveseat by the windows. The bed and linens super comfy. Lovely gas fireplace . Tucked away in a little alcove was a coffee, refrig. stocked with complimentary drinks. and a wet bar. The bath was clean and well sized with a nice marble vanity. Charming lobby (with a jar of freshly baked homemade cookies everyday). An excellent breakfast every morning, in the main salon downstairs. This area is spacious cozy, set up like several drawing rooms in a country manor. There were also two outside gardens areas which were lovely, hard to believe you were in the city when sitting out there. The evening wine and cheese social is very nice, allows you to meet some of the other guests, and compare outings and find out about points of interest. Highly recommend this charming establishment. Our future trips to San Francisco will always include a stay at The White Swan.

Reviews.Title: “European Feel”
Reviews.Author: Cratefirs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights at this lovely hotel. It was like staying in a small hotel in Europe. We enjoyed everything at this location. The breakfasts were fun and the accomodations in our fourth floor room were very nice. The location is quiet, but close to shopping and the cable cars.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous White Swan Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull Inn, awsome decorating, large room and the best breakfast (included in your rate) you could ask for. The downstairs living rooms were spacious and well appointed, free sodas, water, wine and cheese daily. Couldn't ask for a nicer hotel or staff. Close to everything in San Francisco and reasonable rates. This is a must go to Inn and my wife and I will be returning. Couldn't have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BrooklineTraveler3
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the White Swan for five nights. We had a deluxe king and a deluxe twin room. Both rooms were spacious, nicely decorated, and very pleasant to come back to at the end of the day. The hotel is not a new building but has every comfort we wanted. The breakfast was terrific. The front desk gave us a list of recommended restaurants at check in, and offered to help with reservations. The hotel is very convenient for touring the city, and we really enjoyed it. In you are looking for a small hotel with a great location, and lots of character, I would recommend the White Swan. My one caution is that it might not be a good place for an elderly person. The elevator is small and you sometimes have to wait a while. We used the stairs most of the time, which was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great option to the conference hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a large conference at the Moscone Center in San Francisco. Rather than stay at a conference related hotel my wife and I opted for the White Swan Inn. We were impressed by the cosy atmosphere of the inn, its close proximity to points of interest and transportation, and particularly by the fact that once inside the front door we felt distant from a city as large as San Francisco. We found our room quite spacious, the decor well appointed, and both noted how comfortable the bed was. During the evening social get together in the downstairs parlor we had the opportunity to meet and talk to folks from other parts of the country and share our thoughts and experiences on places to visit and see, something that is difficult if not impossible to do at a large hotel. I felt as though we were literally at a home away from home. Given the chance to return to San Francisco I will return to the White Swan Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bathtub!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a 2 star rating because it is not a Hotel... it's a large Bed & Breakfast with a few distinct problems. #1 The bathtubs are an absolute nightmare! Think "YUK" and you'll get a mental picture. They are so old that they're rusty and corroded around the drains. The hotel is supposedly redoing them next week, but what good did that do me? I got robbed out of my daily hot bath & wore flip flops in the shower so my feet didn't have to touch the black stuff. I asked to switch rooms, but the only one available with a refinished bathtub had a BROKEN FIREPLACE!!! Real classy. #2 If you have eyesight problems, don't try to watch TV. It's a million miles away from the bed. #3 The bed is REALLY comfy, but the rest of the room needs help. #4 Old, old, old elevator. #5 OK, ok... So it's within walking distance of Union Square & Chinatown. However, all the hotels along Powell Street (Westin St. Francis, Chancellor, etc.) are MUCH more convenient!!! If you want to stay off Powell, choose The Orchard. The saving grace of this B&B is the yummy breakfast buffet, the SUPERIOR wine/ fruit & cheese sampling at 5:00pm, and the adorable bellman, Louis. The only way that I would ever stay at this B&B again is if they sent me a voucher for a free night's stay AFTER they refinished the ALL bathtubs & fixed ALL the fireplaces. Otherwise, for the hefty $200 price tag, I'm at the Westin St. Francis. Hope my reveiw helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: CrystalRose54
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at the White Swann Inn and can thoroughly recommend it, the room was beautiful and very comfortable and the staff extremely friendly. It is perfectly positioned for touring the city as just one block to the cable cars for Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square and China Town. The complimentary breakfast was very good too!

Reviews.Title: “The White Swan is lovely!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned to England after the most wonderful two weeks touring California with my son. Our last two nights were spent at the White Swan Inn in San Francisco and we weren't disappointed. The first impression we had was of the friendliness of the reception staff. They were very helpful and gave us so much information and advice regarding restaurants, bars etc. We were very impressed with our room...lovely furnishings and lots of space which we don't seem to get in English hotels! Within minutes we had a knock on the door to enquire if we had everything we required...a very nice touch. The hotel has lots of character and we were very pleasantly surprised to find we could meet up with fellow guests late afternoons for a buffet and wine etc in the lounge...just what the doctor ordered after a hard day's sight seeing. The White Swan's location is very central and only a few minutes walk down hill to Union Square and China Town....we took the cable car back which dropped us off close to the hotel. All in all, a great end to a brilliant holiday and I would certainly recommend the White Swan to anyone wanting a central hotel with great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is an okay hotel, but a bit overrated on tripadvisor. * the room was okay, but the fireplace was not working, and even though we asked them to fix it, it never got fixed during our stay. there is no bath tub, just a shower. * the breakfast is alright, better than the breakfast at a holiday inn, but not as good as a bed & breakfast. * the elevator was terrible; it was old, and if someone forgot to close the door (it didn't shut automatically), nobody could use the elevator. several times, we had to use the stairs to get to our room on the top floor. we switched to a different hotel (commodore) after two days.

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad.. still my favorite”
Reviews.Author: flifish
Reviews.Content: I feel with all the gleaming reviews I must try to give a clear picture of this Inn. While this is not a luxurious Inn it has what many places are missing, and is my favorite SF hotel. A personality, wonderful customer service, clean nice sized rooms with fireplaces, a good breakfast with fresh fruit, eggs, and more, and an afternoon wine reception where you can visit with other guests. This Inn is not perfect but the staff is clearly trained very well to be friendly and helpful with suggestions for restaurants, sites, and shopping. The property is not a swank, modern, marble headstone for the new age. No credit card like key for the doors, you buzz to enter this hotel then given your own "house" keys. It reminds you of what the name implies, a country Inn, which reminiscent of staying at Aunt Mary's house, only much better. The hallway to the rooms are a little dark and may give you the idea that you choose the wrong hotel. However, when you open the door to your room you will know you are home. The fireplace rooms are large for a city hotel with books on the shelves, homey wallpaper, and windows that open. The ample sized bathroom, while not new, has tub with shower curtains, hair dryer, quality shampoos and lotions, is clean and comfortable, as with most hotels this one could use some more shelf space in the bathroom. their web site lists various amenities. The location is about 3 blocks from union square proper. Within site of the hotel are some small neighborhood grocery type stores where you can restock on forgotten items and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I called the White Swan Inn to check out staying there for what could be the most romantic weekend of my life with a man I've been in love with for 32 years but never with as a couple. Right away they asked me about my expectations for my stay in SF. I told them the above statement and they sprung into action. A few days later, I received a call from Nevin with ideas on how together we could make this a stay right out of the movies. I have never experienced that level of service or enthusiasm that they showed for a potential guest. They were good to their word and made our stay something right out of the most romantic movie ever. They offered such personal and world class service without being invasive. We were bowled over by their thoughfulness. The rooms look like they belong in a Jane Austen novel with every thoughtful detail attended to. Throughout the stay everyone at the hotel was so gracious. Even as we checked out the bellboy brought bottles of water to our car for the ride. It was such a great feeling to have the staff go beyond your expectations at every turn. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, for the quaint charm and for the first rate service. The price was very reasonable for what you received. Even as we enjoyed sherry in the late afternoon, we were greeted by the manager of the hotel. It was truly lovely and ranks at the top of my list ( and I have stayed at such notable hotels as The Penisula in Hong Kong.) Try this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the White Swan Inn for 4 nights in February 2005. We were very satisfied with our stay. We were very comfortable and enjoyed the many extras - turndown service, chocolates, roses in the room, Aveda bath products, quality breakfast, fireplace. We were not able to attend the afternoon wine service because we were out and about the city in the afternoon. The location was covenient - close to transportation and restaurants. It's a charming Inn with wonderful service at a great value. We would stay there again if in SF on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - But not what we expected from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for a belated birthday and were a little dissappointed. The room was nice but "used". There were some trash on the floor under the bed, the two nightstands were broken and it didn't seem quaint but more like old. The fireplace was nice but the bathrooms are very small. The couch in the room sunk to the ground when you sat on it. The wine and cheese was ok. (We are from Napa so we are a little spoiled regarding wine.) The breakfast was very nice. All in all, it was ok but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in SF a number of times and each time at different hotels ( Holiday Inn, Hyatt Regency and others) so this year in Sept '04 picked the White Swan following reviews in Tripadvisor. It totally lived up to our expectations: very friendly and helpful staff, lovely public areas with very interesting and at times very amusing pieces of art (pottery, pictures, ornaments etc) and terrific bedrooms: very large, very well furnished, gas fire, personal library, fridge/mini kitchen area. Good breakfast and nice touch with the cheese and wine at "tea-time". Great place! Terry - Coventry, England

Reviews.Title: “Loved the White Swan”
Reviews.Author: baseballgirl
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here a few days before Christmas and had a wonderful stay. We loved the fireplace in our room. We chose to have our breakfast brought to us in bed for an additional $5 and it was decadent! Good location between Union Square and Nob Hill. We will definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: White Swan Inn, a Joie de Vivre Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 845 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA 94108
